NTCIP_1218-697
3.5.1.2.2.2.2 Forward Message to the V2X Interface
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1630 Immediate Forward Table
NTCIP_1218-1633 Forward Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1634 Forward Message PSID
NTCIP_1218-1635 Forward Message Transmission Channel
NTCIP_1218-1636 Forward Message Enable
NTCIP_1218-1637 Forward Message Status
NTCIP_1218-1640 Forward Message Payload
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-309 Manage Received Messages for Forwarding …
NTCIP_1218-698

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store a received message to be forwarded immediately to the V2X interface for transmission. The received message shall be authenticated and from a trusted source.
2024-07-22: Kenneth Vaughn

The title and traced user need suggests a need for a true forwarding service (i.e., an incoming packet is forwarded to a different network interface at the network layer based on a configuration), which is not fulfilled by this requirement. The requirement suggests that the message is stored (e.g., as a standard SNMP operation rather than coming into a separate port) and immediately forwarded (i.e., still a single operation). The purpose of the storage is unclear.

The design also fails to satisfy the requirement or the user need. The design stores the message (one operation) and then allows a second operation to enable the forwarding of the message. 

separate action to send the message (i.e., by the ITS application entity; a higher-layer function). Either the need or the design need to be revised.
NTCIP_1218-699
3.5.1.2.2.2.3 Store the Message Type for a Message for Forwarding to the V2X Interface
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…

NTCIP_1218-1640 Forward Message Payload
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-309 Manage Received Messages for Forwarding …
NTCIP_1218-700

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the message type of a message received for forwarding to the V2X interface for transmission. The message type is identified by the DE_DSRC_MessageID data element, as defined in SAE J2735.
NTCIP_1218-701

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the user priority assigned for a message received for forwarding to the V2X interface for transmission. For a V2X radio, the user priority is an integer value and is defined in IEEE 1609.3.

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the transmission channel, as defined by the appropriate regulatory domain, that a received message for forwarding to the V2X interface is to be transmitted on. The valid values for the transmission channel are 0 to 255.
NTCIP_1218-707

Note: For radios using IEEE 802.11, the transmission channel number is defined by IEEE 802.11. For PC5 radios, the equivalent transmission channel number is defined in Table 7, where EARFCN is the E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number.
NTCIP_1218-708

Note: In the United States at the time of publication, the transmission channel is a value of 180 and a value of 183.
NTCIP_1218-709
3.5.1.2.2.2.7 Store if a Received Message for Forwarding to the V2X Interface is Signed
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1630 Immediate Forward Table
NTCIP_1218-1633 Forward Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1637 Forward Message Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-10 Store if a Received Message for Forwardi…
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-309 Manage Received Messages for Forwarding …
NTCIP_1218-710

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store if the payload of a received message is to be signed prior to forwarding the message for transmission to the V2X interface. A RSU has three options for signing the payload of a received message for forwarding: sign, which is to sign and wrap the message into an appropriate security header; do-not-sign, which still wraps the message into a security header but without signing the message; and pass-through, which transmits the payload "as-is" without even wrapping the message into a security header. This last option assumes that the transmitter of the payload already put the appropriate security header into the payload.
NTCIP_1218-711
3.5.1.2.2.3 Manage Messages Received from the V2X Interface Requirements
NTCIP_1218-712

The requirements for the RSU to manage messages received by the RSU over the V2X interface follow.
NTCIP_1218-713
3.5.1.2.2.3.1 Determine Maximum Number of Message Received Types Supported
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1642 Maximum Number of Messages
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-311 Manage Received Messages from the V2X In…
NTCIP_1218-714

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall report the maximum number of message types and message destinations for forwarding that can supported on the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-715
3.5.1.2.2.3.2 Store Network Destination to Forward Messages Received from the V2X Interface
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1643 Received Messages Table
NTCIP_1218-1646 Received Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1647 Received Message PSID
NTCIP_1218-1648 Received Message Destination Address
NTCIP_1218-1649 Received Message Destination Port
NTCIP_1218-1655 Received Message Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-311 Manage Received Messages from the V2X In…
NTCIP_1218-716

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the network address and port number that all messages received from the V2X interface with a specified PSID are to be forwarded to. A message with a specified PSID may be forwarded to more than one network address and port number.
NTCIP_1218-717
3.5.1.2.2.3.3 Store Transport Protocol to Forward Messages Received from the V2X Interface
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1643 Received Messages Table
NTCIP_1218-1646 Received Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1647 Received Message PSID
NTCIP_1218-1650 Received Message Destination Protocol
NTCIP_1218-1655 Received Message Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-311 Manage Received Messages from the V2X In…
NTCIP_1218-718

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the transport protocol to use to forward all messages received from the V2X interface with a specified PSID to a specified network address and port number.
NTCIP_1218-719
3.5.1.2.2.3.4 Store Minimum Signal Strength to Forward Messages Received from the V2X Interface
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1643 Received Messages Table
NTCIP_1218-1646 Received Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1647 Received Message PSID
NTCIP_1218-1651 Received Message Minimum Signal Strength
NTCIP_1218-1655 Received Message Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-311 Manage Received Messages from the V2X In…
NTCIP_1218-720

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the minimum received signal strength indication (RSSI) level of the message received from the V2X interface with a specified PSID, before forwarding the message to a specified network address and port number. Valid RSSI levels are from -100 to -60 dbm in units of 1 dbm.
NTCIP_1218-721
3.5.1.2.2.3.5 Store Message Interval to Forward Messages Received from the V2X Interface
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1643 Received Messages Table
NTCIP_1218-1646 Received Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1647 Received Message PSID
NTCIP_1218-1652 Received Message Forwarding Interval
NTCIP_1218-1655 Received Message Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-311 Manage Received Messages from the V2X In…
NTCIP_1218-722

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the message interval for forwarding messages received from the V2X interface with a specified PSID to a specified network address and port number. This requirement forwards every Nth message received by the V2X interface meeting all the specified criteria (PSID, RSSI) to the specified network address and port number. Valid values for n are from 1 to 9, with 1 indicating that all messages are to be forwarded.
NTCIP_1218-723
3.5.1.2.2.3.6 Store Start Time to Forward Messages Received from the V2X Interface
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1643 Received Messages Table
NTCIP_1218-1646 Received Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1647 Received Message PSID
NTCIP_1218-1653 Received Message Forwarding Start Time
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-311 Manage Received Messages from the V2X In…
NTCIP_1218-724

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the start date and time that messages received from the V2X interface with a specified PSID are to be forwarded to a specified network address and port number.
NTCIP_1218-725
3.5.1.2.2.3.7 Store Stop Time to Forward Messages Received from the V2X Interface
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1643 Received Messages Table
NTCIP_1218-1646 Received Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1647 Received Message PSID
NTCIP_1218-1654 Received Message Forwarding Stop Time
NTCIP_1218-1655 Received Message Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-311 Manage Received Messages from the V2X In…
NTCIP_1218-726

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the stop date and time that messages received from the V2X interface with a specified PSID are to stop being forwarded to a specified network address and port number.
NTCIP_1218-727
3.5.1.2.2.3.8 Enable/Disable Forwarding Messages Received from the V2X Interface
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1643 Received Messages Table
NTCIP_1218-1646 Received Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1647 Received Message PSID

NTCIP_1218-1655 Received Message Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-311 Manage Received Messages from the V2X In…
NTCIP_1218-728

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store if messages received from the V2X interface with a specified PSID are to be forwarded to a specified network address and port number.
NTCIP_1218-729
3.5.1.2.2.3.9 Store Secure Options to Forward Messages Received from the V2X Interface
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1643 Received Messages Table
NTCIP_1218-1646 Received Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1647 Received Message PSID
NTCIP_1218-1655 Received Message Status
NTCIP_1218-1656 Received Message Forward Secure Option
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-311 Manage Received Messages from the V2X In…
NTCIP_1218-730

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store if only the payload content of the messages received from the V2X interface are forwarded to a specified network address and port number. This requirement allows the RSU is to strip any certificates and signatures from the message before forwarding the payload content.
NTCIP_1218-731
3.5.1.2.2.3.10 Store Interval to Authenticate Messages Received from the V2X Interface
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1643 Received Messages Table
NTCIP_1218-1646 Received Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1647 Received Message PSID
NTCIP_1218-1655 Received Message Status
NTCIP_1218-1657 Received Message Forward Secure Interval
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-311 Manage Received Messages from the V2X In…
NTCIP_1218-732

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the interval for authenticating messages received from the V2X interface with a specified PSID to a specified network address and port number and marked for forwarding. This requirement instructs the RSU to check the certificate and signature of every Nth message received by the V2X interface meeting all the specified criteria (PSID, RSSI) to the specified network address and port number and marked for forwarding (See 3.5.1.2.2.3.5). Valid values for n are from 1 to 9, with 1 indicating that all messages are to be forwarded. A value of 0 indicates that authentication is disabled.
NTCIP_1218-733
3.5.1.2.2.4 Forward Messages Transmitted Over the V2X Interface Requirements
NTCIP_1218-734

The requirements for the RSU to forward to a specified network destination messages transmitted over the V2X interface follow.
NTCIP_1218-735
3.5.1.2.2.4.1 Determine Maximum Number of Message Entries Transmitted Over the V2X Interface For Forwarding Supported
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1934 Maximum Number of Transmitted Messages f…
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-313 Manage Transmitted Messages over the V2X…
NTCIP_1218-736

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall report the maximum number of message types transmitted over the V2X interface and message destinations for forwarding that can supported on the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-737

NTCIP_1218-1941 Transmitted Messages for Forwarding Dest…
NTCIP_1218-1945 Received Message Forward Secure Option
NTCIP_1218-1946 Transmitted Messages for Forwarding Stat…
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-313 Manage Transmitted Messages over the V2X…
NTCIP_1218-738

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the network destination that the RSU forwards the messages that have been transmitted over the V2X interface with a specified PSID. The network destination consists of the IP address, the port number and a text description of the interface.
NTCIP_1218-739

NTCIP_1218-744

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the stop date and time that messages transmitted over the V2X interface with a specified PSID are to stop being forwarded to a specified network address and port number.
NTCIP_1218-745
3.5.1.2.3 Logging of Interface Data Requirements
NTCIP_1218-746

The requirements to manage the interface data logs for the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-747
3.5.1.2.3.1 Determine Maximum Number of Interface Logs Supported
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1671 Maximum Number of Interface Logs
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-748

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall report the maximum number of active interface logs that can be supported on the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-749
3.5.1.2.3.2 Log Interface Data Identification
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1672 Interface Log Table
NTCIP_1218-1675 Interface Log Index
NTCIP_1218-1676 Interface Log Enable
NTCIP_1218-1680 Interface Name
NTCIP_1218-1686 Interface Log Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-750

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store a list of interfaces for which the RSU shall log all transmitted and received packets.
NTCIP_1218-751
3.5.1.2.3.3 Log Interface Data by Direction
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:

NTCIP_1218-1675 Interface Log Index

NTCIP_1218-1686 Interface Log Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-752

Upon request from a management station and if the RSU is logging packets, the RSU shall generate separate log files for transmitted and received packets across a specified interface.
NTCIP_1218-753
3.5.1.2.3.4 Store Interface Data Log - File Directory
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…

NTCIP_1218-1686 Interface Log Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-754

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the interface data logs in a specified directory on the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-755

Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1206 Secure Copy Protocol Dialog

NTCIP_1218-1681 Interface Log Storage Path
NTCIP_1218-1682 Interface Log Name
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-756

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall return the logged data in the interface data log.
NTCIP_1218-757
3.5.1.2.3.6 Store an Interface Data Log Start Time
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1672 Interface Log Table
NTCIP_1218-1675 Interface Log Index
NTCIP_1218-1683 Interface Log Start Time
NTCIP_1218-1686 Interface Log Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-758

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the start date and time to begin logging data packets across a specified interface.
NTCIP_1218-759
3.5.1.2.3.7 Store an Interface Data Log Stop Time
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1672 Interface Log Table
NTCIP_1218-1675 Interface Log Index
NTCIP_1218-1684 Interface Log Stop Time
NTCIP_1218-1686 Interface Log Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-760

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall store the stop date and time to stop logging data packets across a specified interface.
NTCIP_1218-761
3.5.1.2.3.8 Store Maximum Interface Data Log File Size
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1672 Interface Log Table
NTCIP_1218-1675 Interface Log Index
NTCIP_1218-1677 Interface Log Maximum File Size
NTCIP_1218-1686 Interface Log Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-762

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the maximum file size supported by the RSU for an interface data log, in megabytes, from 1 to 40 megabytes. The RSU is to open a new interface data log file when an active interface data log reaches this maximum interface data log file size. This requirement allows the transportation manager to determine if there is sufficient space to continue storing interface data logs without crashing the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-763
3.5.1.2.3.9 Store Maximum Interface Data Log File Collection Time
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1672 Interface Log Table
NTCIP_1218-1675 Interface Log Index
NTCIP_1218-1678 Interface Log Maximum Collection Time
NTCIP_1218-1686 Interface Log Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-764

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the minimum collection time supported by the RSU for an interface data log, in hours, from 1 to 48 hours. The RSU is to open a new interface data log file when an active interface data log reaches this maximum interface data log time.
NTCIP_1218-765
3.5.1.2.3.10 Store Interface Data Log Option - Disk Full
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1672 Interface Log Table
NTCIP_1218-1675 Interface Log Index
NTCIP_1218-1686 Interface Log Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-11 Store Interface Data Log Option - Disk F…
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-766

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store if the RSU is to stop interface data logging or delete the oldest interface data log file is the disk space available for interface data logs is full.
NTCIP_1218-767
3.5.1.2.3.11 Store Interface Data Log Option - Entry Deletion
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1672 Interface Log Table
NTCIP_1218-1675 Interface Log Index
NTCIP_1218-1686 Interface Log Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-12 Store Interface Data Log Option - Entry …
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-768

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store if the RSU is to delete the interface data log file when its interface data log entry is deleted. It is assumed that a transportation manager retrieves the interface data log file from the RSU before deleting the interface data log entry from the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-769

3.5.1.3 Configure V2X Interfaces Requirements
NTCIP_1218-770

The requirements to configure the V2X interface for the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-771
3.5.1.3.1 Configure Radio Requirements
NTCIP_1218-772

The requirements to configure the radios associated with the V2X interface for an RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-773
3.5.1.3.1.1 Report Maximum Number of V2X Radios Supported
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1592 Maximum Radios
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-319 Enable/Disable Radios
NTCIP_1218-774

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the maximum number of V2X radios supported by the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-775
3.5.1.3.1.2 Report Type of V2X Radio
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1179 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Static T…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1592 Maximum Radios
NTCIP_1218-1593 Radio Table
NTCIP_1218-1596 RSU Radio Index
NTCIP_1218-1599 RSU Radio Type
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-319 Enable/Disable Radios
NTCIP_1218-776

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the type of V2X radios managed by the RSU. Valid values are dsrc and PC5.
NTCIP_1218-777
3.5.1.3.1.3 Enable/Disable Radios
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1195 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1593 Radio Table
NTCIP_1218-1596 RSU Radio Index
NTCIP_1218-1598 RSU Radio Enable
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-319 Enable/Disable Radios
NTCIP_1218-778

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall enable or disable a V2X radio managed by the RSU. This requirement allows a transportation manager to stop the radio from broadcasting and receiving messages.
NTCIP_1218-779
3.5.1.3.1.4 Report Radio MAC Address
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1593 Radio Table
NTCIP_1218-1596 RSU Radio Index
NTCIP_1218-1600 RSU Radio MAC Address 1
NTCIP_1218-1601 RSU Radio MAC Address 2
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-319 Enable/Disable Radios
NTCIP_1218-780

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the IEEE 802.11 MAC address of each V2X radio managed by the RSU. If the V2X interface is DSRC, it reports the MAC address; if the V2X radio is PC5, it reports the radio index (i.e. radio 1, radio 2, etc.).
NTCIP_1218-781
3.5.1.3.1.5 Report Radio Operating Modes
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1862 RSU Radio Status
Conditionally meets:
NTCIP_1218-319 Enable/Disable Radios
NTCIP_1218-782

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report if its V2X radios are operating in continuous or alternating modes.
NTCIP_1218-783
3.5.1.3.1.6 Report LTE-V2X Communications Status
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1872 RSU PC5 Communications Status
Conditionally meets:
NTCIP_1218-319 Enable/Disable Radios
NTCIP_1218-784

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the status of the communications for a V2X PC5 (LTE-V2X) radio.
NTCIP_1218-785
3.5.1.3.2 Determine Lower Layer Requirements
NTCIP_1218-786

The requirements to report the lower layer parameters associated with the V2X interface for an RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-787
3.5.1.3.2.1 Determine Lower Layer Parameter
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
IEEE802dot11-1238 Conceptual table for EDCA default parame…
IEEE802dot11-1240 The auxiliary variable used to identify …
IEEE802dot11-1241 This is a control variable. It is writt…
IEEE802dot11-1242 This is a control variable. It is writt…
IEEE802dot11-1243 This is a control variable. It is writt…
Conditionally meets:
NTCIP_1218-321 Determine Lower Layer Parameters
NTCIP_1218-788

Upon request from a management station, if the V2X radio is a DSRC interface, the RSU shall report an enhanced distributed channel access (EDCA) parameter set for a V2X radio. The EDCA parameter set consists of, as defined in IEEE 802.11, the Arbitration Interframe Spacing (AIFSN), Contention Window Minimum Value (CWmin), Contention Window Maximum Value (CWmax), and the Transmission Opportunity (TXOP) limit.
NTCIP_1218-789
3.5.1.3.2.2 Determine Operating Class
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
IEEE802dot11-267 (Conceptual) table of attributes for ope…
IEEE802dot11-269 The auxiliary variable used to identify …
rfc2863-19 A list of interface entries. The number …
rfc2863-22 A unique value, greater than zero, for e…
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-13 Determine Operating Class
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-321 Determine Lower Layer Parameters
NTCIP_1218-790

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the operating class, as defined in IEEE 802.11 or media used, that a V2X radio is configured for. Valid values for the operating class are from 0 to 255.
NTCIP_1218-791
3.5.1.3.3 Configure IEEE 1609 Communications Requirements
NTCIP_1218-792

The requirements to configure the IEEE 1609 parameters for the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-793
3.5.1.3.3.1 Manage IEEE 1609.2 Security Requirements
NTCIP_1218-794

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall obtain and manage IEEE 1609.2 certificates to sign and encrypt messages for transmission via the radio. An RSU is expected to have two types of certificates, enrollment certificates and application certificates. Enrollment certificates are handled by the RSU manufacturer and contains the domain name URL where the application certificates would come from. The requirements to configure IEEE 1609.2 certificates for the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-795
3.5.1.3.3.1.1 Report IEEE 1609.2 Enrollment Certificate - Status
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1689 Enrollment Certificate Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-796

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the status of the enrollment certificates. The valid values are notEnrolled, enrolled, unknown, and other.
NTCIP_1218-797
3.5.1.3.3.1.2 Report IEEE 1609.2 Enrollment Certificate - Expiration Date
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1693 Enrollment Certificate Expiration
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-798

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the expiration date of the enrollment certificates.
NTCIP_1218-799
3.5.1.3.3.1.3 Report IEEE 1609.2 Enrollment Certificate - Source Domain
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1691 Enrollment Certificate Source Domain
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-800

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the domain uniform resource locator (URL) of the Certificate Authority that is the source of the enrollment certificate.
NTCIP_1218-801
3.5.1.3.3.1.4 Report IEEE 1609.2 Enrollment Certificate Identifier
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1692 Enrollment Certificate Identifier
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-802

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the certificate identifier associated with the Enrollment certificate. The identifier is the hexadecimal string representation of the IEEE 1609.2 HashedId8 of the Enrollment Certificate. The identifier, which should be human readable, is used to track the device's enrollment status via the SCMS.
NTCIP_1218-803
3.5.1.3.3.1.5 Report IEEE 1609.2 Enrollment Certificate - Valid Region
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1690 Enrollment Certificate Valid Region
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-804

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report a region identifier, such as a country code, that the enrollment certificate is valid for. For the United States, the valid region identifier is the country code, 840.
NTCIP_1218-805
3.5.1.3.3.1.6 Report IEEE 1609.2 Enrollment Certificate - Source
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1694 Enrollment Certificate Source
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-806

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report if the source of the enrollment certificates is the Security Credential Management System (SCMS) or the certificates were manually loaded (obtained).
NTCIP_1218-807
3.5.1.3.3.1.7 Report IEEE 1609.2 Application Certificates - Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1179 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Static T…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1696 Maximum Application Certificates
NTCIP_1218-1697 Application Certificate Table
NTCIP_1218-1700 Application Certificate Index
NTCIP_1218-1701 Application Certificate PSID
NTCIP_1218-1702 Application Certificate State
NTCIP_1218-1703 Application Certificate Expiration
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-808

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the status of the application certificates. The valid values are valid, notValid, future, expirationPending, other, and unknown.
NTCIP_1218-809
3.5.1.3.3.1.8 Report IEEE 1609.2 Application Certificates - Source
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1695 Application Certificate Source
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-810

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the domain uniform resource locator (URL) from which to request new application certificates.
NTCIP_1218-811
3.5.1.3.3.1.9 Store IEEE 1609.2 Application Certificates - Default Request Interval
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1688 Security Credentials Request
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-812

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the default interval, in hours, between new requests for application certificates.
NTCIP_1218-813
3.5.1.3.3.1.10 Store IEEE 1609.2 Application Certificates - Request Interval
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1195 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1697 Application Certificate Table
NTCIP_1218-1700 Application Certificate Index
NTCIP_1218-1701 Application Certificate PSID
NTCIP_1218-1704 Application Certificate Request
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-814

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the interval, in hours, between new requests for application certificates for a specified PSID.
NTCIP_1218-815
3.5.1.3.3.1.11 Report Certificate Revocation List - Source
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1705 Certificate Revocation List Source
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-816

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) URL, in the format defined by RFC 4701, from which to request updated certificate revocation lists.
NTCIP_1218-817
3.5.1.3.3.1.12 Report Certificate Revocation List - Update Time
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1706 Certificate Revocation List Update Time
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-818

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the date and time the certificate revocation list was last updated.
NTCIP_1218-819
3.5.1.3.3.1.13 Store Certificate Revocation List Update Interval
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1707 Certificate Revocation Update Interval
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-820

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the interval, in hours, between requests for an updated certificate revocation list.
NTCIP_1218-821
3.5.1.3.3.1.14 Update Certificate Revocation List Command
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1708 Certificate Revocation List Command
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-822

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall make a request to update its certificate revocation list from the certificate authority.
NTCIP_1218-823
3.5.1.3.3.1.15 Report IEEE 1609.2 Security Profiles
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1179 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Static T…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1709 Maximum Number of Security Profile Entri…
NTCIP_1218-1710 Security Profiles
NTCIP_1218-1713 RSU Security Profile Index
NTCIP_1218-1714 RSU Security Profile Name
NTCIP_1218-1715 RSU Security Profile Description
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-824

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the name and description of the IEEE 1609.2 security profile for a PSID stored on the RSU. A security profile proforma is defined in IEEE 1609.2.
NTCIP_1218-825
3.5.1.3.3.1.16 Configure Certificate Expiration Pending Period
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1716 RSU Application Certificate Expiration P…
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-325 Configure IEEE 1609.2 Security
NTCIP_1218-826

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the number of days before the application certificate expires. Within this number of days, the application certificate status is changed to expirationPending. This requirement sets a flag to indicate that application certificates are close to expiring.
NTCIP_1218-827
3.5.1.3.3.2 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - WSA Requirements
NTCIP_1218-828

The requirements to configure the WAVE Service Advertisement (WSA) for the RSU follow. Broadcast messages from a V2X radio are not required to be preceded by or associated with a WSA. Note that the WSA is identified as an application that has a unique PSID and potentially a unique certificate. Refer to 3.5.1.3.3.1 for application certificate requirements.
NTCIP_1218-829
3.5.1.3.3.2.1 Determine Maximum Number of Services Advertised
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1721 Maximum Number of WSA Services
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-830

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall report the maximum number of PSIDs that can be advertised by the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-831
3.5.1.3.3.2.2 Store WSA Configuration - Service Info Segment
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1722 WAVE Service Advertisement Service Table
NTCIP_1218-1725 WAVE Service Advertisement Index
NTCIP_1218-1726 WAVE Service Advertisement PSID
NTCIP_1218-1727 WAVE Service Advertisement Priority
NTCIP_1218-1728 WAVE Service Advertisement Provider Serv…
NTCIP_1218-1729 WAVE Service Advertisement Application H…
NTCIP_1218-1730 WAVE Service Advertisement Application P…
NTCIP_1218-1731 WAVE Service Advertisement Application C…
NTCIP_1218-1732 WAVE Service Advertisement Status
NTCIP_1218-1733 WAVE Service Advertisement MAC Address
NTCIP_1218-1735 WAVE Service Advertisement RCPI Threshol…
NTCIP_1218-1736 WAVE Service Advertisement Count Thresho…
NTCIP_1218-1737 WAVE Service Advertisement Count Interva…
NTCIP_1218-1738 WAVE Service Advertisement Repeat Rate
NTCIP_1218-1739 WAVE Service Advertiser Identifier
NTCIP_1218-1740 WAVE Service Advertisement Enable
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-832

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store a service info segment for a WSA. A service info segment for a WSA is defined in IEEE 1609.3 and provides information about a service, which is usually an application that is advertised by and accessible from or through the RSU. A service info segment consists of the PSID; the Provider Service Context (PSC) information; the IPv6 address, port number and provider MAC address used to access the application service; the RCPI threshold; the WSA count threshold, WSA count threshold interval, and if the service is a routed service. All elements in the service info segment are optional except the PSID. Note that a WSA is not required to support broadcast messages.
NTCIP_1218-833
3.5.1.3.3.2.3 Store WSA Configuration - Channel Info Segment
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1741 WAVE Service Advertisement Channel Table
NTCIP_1218-1744 WAVE Service Advertisement Channel Index
NTCIP_1218-1745 WAVE Service Advertisement Channel PSID
NTCIP_1218-1746 WAVE Service Advertisement Channel Numbe…
NTCIP_1218-1747 WAVE Service Advertisement Transmit Powe…
NTCIP_1218-1748 WAVE Service Advertisement Transmit Chan…
NTCIP_1218-1749 WAVE Service Advertisement Channel Statu…
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-834

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the desired transmission information for a service provided by the RSU. The transmission information consists of the operating class, the transmission channel (number) to advertise the service, the transmit power level to be used, and the transmission interval for the advertisement. The RSU uses this information to advertise services on the appropriate transmission channels, power levels, and intervals.
NTCIP_1218-835
3.5.1.3.3.2.4 Configure WSA Configuration - WAVE Router Advertisement
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1768 WAVE Router Advertisement Prefix
NTCIP_1218-1769 WAVE Router Advertisement Prefix Length
NTCIP_1218-1770 WAVE Router Advertisement Gateway
NTCIP_1218-1771 WAVE Router Advertisement Primary DNS
NTCIP_1218-1772 WAVE Router Advertisement Secondary DNS
NTCIP_1218-1773 WAVE Router Advertisement Gateway MAC
NTCIP_1218-1774 WAVE Router Advertisement Lifetime
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-836

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall configure a WAVE router advertisement (WRA) segment for a WSA. A WRA segment for a WSA is defined in IEEE 1609.3 and provides information to configure an IPv6 interface so messages received from a connected device via the V2X can be immediately exchanged with a remote host. A WRA contains the network address of the remote host, the network gateway, the primary Domain Name System (DNS), and optionally the network address of the secondary DNS and gateway MAC address.
NTCIP_1218-837
3.5.1.3.3.2.5 Store WSA Configuration – Secure [Deprecated]
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1722 WAVE Service Advertisement Service Table
NTCIP_1218-1725 WAVE Service Advertisement Index
NTCIP_1218-1726 WAVE Service Advertisement PSID
NTCIP_1218-1734 WAVE Service Advertisement Options
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-838

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store whether the WSA transmitted over the V2X interface are to be secure (signed) or unsecure.
NTCIP_1218-839

Note: This requirement has been replaced in NTCIP 1218 v01A because NTCIP 1218 v01 incorrectly allows a management station to configure whether the WSA transmitted over the V2X interface is secure or unsecure based on the PSID. The replacement can be found in 3.5.1.3.3.2.7. See Annex D.1.2 for more information regarding this change from v01 to v01A of NTCIP 1218.
NTCIP_1218-840
3.5.1.3.3.2.6 Report WSA Version Number
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1750 WAVE Service Advertisement Version
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-841

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the WSA Version Number, as defined in IEEE 1609.3, used by the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-842
3.5.1.3.3.2.7 Store WSA Configuration – Secure V2
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-14 Store WSA Configuration – Secure V2
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-843

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store whether the WSA transmitted over the V2X interface is to be secure (signed) or unsecure. In practice, the WSA should always be secure.
NTCIP_1218-844

Note: This previously available requirement to store whether the WSA transmitted over the V2X interface is to be secure (signed) or unsecure has been deprecated in NTCIP 1218 v01A. This replacement was made because the configuration is not based on the PSID but applies to the entire WSA. The previously available requirement can be found in 3.5.1.3.3.2.5. See Annex D.1.2 for more information regarding this change from v01 to v01A of NTCIP 1218.
NTCIP_1218-845
3.5.1.3.3.2.8 Store WSA Configuration – WAVE Routing Advertisement
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-15 Store WSA Configuration – WAVE Routing A…
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-846

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store whether the WSA transmitted over the V2X interface includes WAVE Routing Advertisement information.
NTCIP_1218-847
3.5.1.3.3.2.9 Store WSA Configuration – Repeat Rate
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-16 Store WSA Configuration – Repeat Rate
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-848

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store whether the WSA transmitted over the V2X interface includes the Repeat Rate. The Repeat Rate indicates the number of times the WSA is transmitted per 5 seconds.
NTCIP_1218-849
3.5.1.3.3.2.10 Store WSA Configuration – 2D Location
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-17 Store WSA Configuration – 2D Location
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-850

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store whether the WSA transmitted over the V2X interface includes the latitude-longitude location of the WSA transmit antenna.
NTCIP_1218-851
3.5.1.3.3.2.11 Store WSA Configuration – 3D Location
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-18 Store WSA Configuration – 3D Location
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-852

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store whether the WSA transmitted over the V2X interface includes the three-dimensional location of the WSA transmit antenna. See IEEE 1609.3 for how elevation is represented.
NTCIP_1218-853
3.5.1.3.3.2.12 Store WSA Configuration – RCPI Threshold
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1722 WAVE Service Advertisement Service Table
NTCIP_1218-1725 WAVE Service Advertisement Index
NTCIP_1218-1726 WAVE Service Advertisement PSID
NTCIP_1218-1732 WAVE Service Advertisement Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-19 Store WSA Configuration – RCPI Threshold
NTCIP_1218-1734 WAVE Service Advertisement Options
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-854

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store whether the WSA transmitted over the V2X interface includes the Received Channel Power Indicator (RCPI) threshold. The RCPI threshold indicates the recommended minimum received WSA signal value, in dBm, below which the application service should be ignored by a recipient.
NTCIP_1218-855
3.5.1.3.3.2.13 Report WSA Configuration – Extended Channel Information
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1753 WSA LTE-V2X EARFCN Channel
NTCIP_1218-1754 WSA LTE-V2X P-Max
NTCIP_1218-1755 WSA LTE-V2X Priorities
NTCIP_1218-1756 WSA LTE-V2X Sidelink Transmission Pool
NTCIP_1218-1757 WSA LTE-V2X Minimum MCS
NTCIP_1218-1758 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum MCS
NTCIP_1218-1759 WSA LTE-V2X Minimum Packet Delay Budget
NTCIP_1218-1760 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum Transmission Unit Si…
NTCIP_1218-1761 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum Bandwidth Per Second
NTCIP_1218-1762 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum Bandwidth Per Second…
NTCIP_1218-1763 WSA LTE-V2X Minimum Periodicity
NTCIP_1218-1764 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum Speed
NTCIP_1218-1765 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum Range
NTCIP_1218-1766 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum Channel Busy Ratio
Conditionally meets:
NTCIP_1218-327 Configure IEEE 1609.3 Communications - W…
NTCIP_1218-856

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the WSA extended channel information segment field for LTE-V2X, as defined in IEEE 1609.3 Section M.6.2.
NTCIP_1218-857
3.5.1.3.3.3 Configure IEEE 1609.4 Communications Requirements
NTCIP_1218-858

The requirements to configure the RSU for multi-channel operations follow. These requirements apply only to DSRC radios.
NTCIP_1218-859
3.5.1.3.3.3.1 Store the IEEE 1609.4 Configuration for a Radio
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1195 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1593 Radio Table
NTCIP_1218-1596 RSU Radio Index
NTCIP_1218-1597 RSU Radio Description
NTCIP_1218-1603 RSU Radio Channel 1
NTCIP_1218-1604 RSU Radio Channel 2
NTCIP_1218-1605 RSU Radio Channel 1 - Default Transmit P…
NTCIP_1218-1606 RSU Radio Channel 2 - Default Transmit P…
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-329 Configure IEEE 1609.4 Communications
NTCIP_1218-860

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the parameters for a radio. The parameters consist of a textual description of the radio, the service channel and the transmission channels the radio operates on as defined by the appropriate regulatory domain. The valid values for the transmission channels are 0 to 255.
NTCIP_1218-861

Note: For radios using IEEE 802.11, the transmission channel number is defined by IEEE 802.11.
NTCIP_1218-862
3.5.1.3.3.3.2 Store Radio Channel Access Mode
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1195 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1593 Radio Table
NTCIP_1218-1596 RSU Radio Index
NTCIP_1218-1602 RSU Radio Channel Mode
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-329 Configure IEEE 1609.4 Communications
NTCIP_1218-863

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the channel access options (continuous, alternating, immediate) of the radio, and if the immediate or extended option for channel switching is used (if applicable). The valid values for channel access options are continuous, alternating, immediate, other and unknown. The channel access mode for an LTE-V2X radio is continuous access.
NTCIP_1218-864
3.5.1.3.4 Configure V2X Radio Transmitter Requirements
NTCIP_1218-865

The requirements to configure the radio transmitter properties associated with the V2X interface for an RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-866
3.5.1.3.4.1 Store Default Transmit Power
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1195 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1593 Radio Table
NTCIP_1218-1596 RSU Radio Index
NTCIP_1218-1605 RSU Radio Channel 1 - Default Transmit P…
NTCIP_1218-1606 RSU Radio Channel 2 - Default Transmit P…
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-331 Configure Radio Transmitter Properties
NTCIP_1218-867

For a message with a specified PSID forwarded to a radio for transmission, upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the default transmit power level, in dBm, at the antenna port to be used for transmission for a channel. The valid range for the default power is from -128 to 127 dBm, in units of 1 dBm.
NTCIP_1218-868

Note: The default transmit power could be dynamic and changed by channel or an application.
NTCIP_1218-869
3.5.1.3.4.2 Report Maximum Number of V2X Antennas Supported
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1851 Maximum Antennas
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-331 Configure Radio Transmitter Properties
NTCIP_1218-870

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the maximum number of V2X antennas supported by the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-871
3.5.1.3.4.3 Store Antenna Gain and Cable Losses
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1195 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1852 Antenna Table
NTCIP_1218-1855 RSU Antenna Index
NTCIP_1218-1859 RSU Antenna Gain
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-331 Configure Radio Transmitter Properties
NTCIP_1218-872

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the antenna gain for a radio antenna, in units of 0.01 dB. This requirement is applicable if the antenna is not direct connect.
NTCIP_1218-873
3.5.1.3.4.4 Store Antenna Type
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1195 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1852 Antenna Table
NTCIP_1218-1855 RSU Antenna Index
NTCIP_1218-1860 RSU Antenna Directional
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-331 Configure Radio Transmitter Properties
NTCIP_1218-874

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the direction that the antenna is pointing at along the horizontal plane. A value of 360 indicates uniform gain in all directions in the horizontal plane.
NTCIP_1218-875

3.5.1.4 Manage RSU Applications Requirements
NTCIP_1218-876

The requirements for managing the applications on the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-877
3.5.1.4.1 Manage RSU Application Requirements
NTCIP_1218-878

The requirements for managing an application on the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-879
3.5.1.4.1.1 Install an RSU Application
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1209 Secure Installation Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1810 RSU Firmware Version
NTCIP_1218-1817 RSU Installation Command
NTCIP_1218-1818 RSU Installation Filename
NTCIP_1218-1819 RSU Installation Path
NTCIP_1218-1820 RSU Installation Status
NTCIP_1218-1840 System Base Directory
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-335 Manage RSU Application
NTCIP_1218-880

Upon request from a management station, an RSU shall support the installation of new or updated software from an authorized source. The installation process allows the transmission of the secure installation files, executable application code and associated support files to support the installation files, and confirmation of a successful update of the software.
NTCIP_1218-881

Note: The expectation is that the management station loads the installation files to the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-882
3.5.1.4.1.2 Report Software Update Status
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1820 RSU Installation Status
NTCIP_1218-1821 RSU Installation Status Time
NTCIP_1218-1822 RSU Installation Status Message
NTCIP_1218-1823 RSU Scheduled Installation Time
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-335 Manage RSU Application
NTCIP_1218-883

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the status of the process to install software, and the date and time the status was last updated. The valid values for status are the following: rejected, roll-backed, processing, successful, and unknown. An attempt to update the software may be rejected for a security reason, such as it has not been authenticated. If applicable, if an attempt to update the software fails, the software should be roll-backed to the pre-update version.
NTCIP_1218-884
3.5.1.4.2 Manage RSU Application Configuration Requirements
NTCIP_1218-885

The requirements for managing the configuration of an application on the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-886
3.5.1.4.2.1 Install a Configuration File
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1209 Secure Installation Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1810 RSU Firmware Version
NTCIP_1218-1817 RSU Installation Command
NTCIP_1218-1818 RSU Installation Filename
NTCIP_1218-1819 RSU Installation Path
NTCIP_1218-1820 RSU Installation Status
NTCIP_1218-1840 System Base Directory
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-337 Save and Restore Application Configurati…
NTCIP_1218-887

Upon request from a management station, an RSU shall begin the installation of a configuration file from an authorized source. The installation allows the transmission of the secure installation files and associated support files to support the installation files, and confirmation of a successful update of the application or process.
NTCIP_1218-888
3.5.1.4.2.2 Report Configuration File Update Status
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1820 RSU Installation Status
NTCIP_1218-1821 RSU Installation Status Time
NTCIP_1218-1822 RSU Installation Status Message
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-337 Save and Restore Application Configurati…
NTCIP_1218-889

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the status of the process to install an updated configuration file, and the date and time the status was last updated. The valid values for status are the following: rejected, roll-backed, processing, successful, and unknown. An attempt to update the configuration file may be rejected for a security reason, such as it has not been authenticated. If an attempt to update the configuration file fails, the configuration file should be rolled-back to the pre-update version.
NTCIP_1218-890
3.5.1.4.3 Support RLVW Application Requirements
NTCIP_1218-891

The requirements to support an RLVW application on the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-892
3.5.1.4.3.1 Receive Movement Maneuver Assist – NTCIP 1202 v03B
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1195 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1966 ASC SPaT Movement Maneuvers Table
NTCIP_1218-1969 ASC SPaT Movement Maneuver Identifer
NTCIP_1218-1970 ASC SPaT Movement Intersection Identifie…
NTCIP_1218-1971 ASC SPaT Movement Signal Group Identifie…
NTCIP_1218-1972 ASC SPaT Movement Queue
NTCIP_1218-1973 ASC SPaT Movement Assist Status
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-339 Support Red Light Violation Warning Appl…
NTCIP_1218-380 Receive SPaT Information
NTCIP_1218-893

Upon request from a traffic signal controller, the RSU shall store movement maneuver assist information for a signalized intersection. The movement maneuver assist information from the traffic signal controller consists of the signal group identifier the assist information is for, the vehicle queue length for that movement maneuver, and if any conflicting pedestrians or bicyclists are detected for that movement maneuver through the intersection. The movement maneuver assist information shall be provided in a format defined by NTCIP 1202 v03B.
NTCIP_1218-894
3.5.1.4.3.2 Receive Advisory Speed – NTCIP 1202 v03B
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1195 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1975 ASC SPaT Advisory Speed Table
NTCIP_1218-1978 ASC SPaT Advisory Speed Index
NTCIP_1218-1979 ASC SPaT Advisory Speed Intersection Ide…
NTCIP_1218-1980 ASC SPaT Advisory Speed Signal Group Ide…
NTCIP_1218-1981 ASC SPaT Advisory Speed Type
NTCIP_1218-1982 ASC SPaT Advisory Speed Advice
NTCIP_1218-1983 ASC SPaT Advisory Speed Zone
NTCIP_1218-1984 ASC SPaT Advisory Speed Restriction Clas…
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-339 Support Red Light Violation Warning Appl…
NTCIP_1218-380 Receive SPaT Information
NTCIP_1218-895

Upon request from a traffic signal controller, the RSU shall store speed advisories for a signalized intersection. The speed advisory information from the traffic signal controller consists of the signal group identifier the advisory is for, the advisory speed, the advisory speed type, the distance from the stop bar the advisory speed is effective for, and the vehicle types the speed advisory is intended for. The speed advisory information shall be provided in a format defined by NTCIP 1202 v03B.
NTCIP_1218-896
3.5.1.4.3.3 Receive SPaT Movement Status – NTCIP 1202 v03B
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1195 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1989 SPaT Table
NTCIP_1218-1992 ASC SPaT Index
NTCIP_1218-1993 ASC SPaT Intersection Identifier
NTCIP_1218-1994 ASC Signal Status Block
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-339 Support Red Light Violation Warning Appl…
NTCIP_1218-380 Receive SPaT Information
NTCIP_1218-897

Upon request from a traffic signal controller, the RSU shall store SPaT information for a signalized intersection. The SPaT information from the traffic signal controllers consists of the intersection status, the enabled lanes in effect, and movement data for the intersection containing what vehicle (or pedestrian) movements are permitted and when. The SPaT information shall be provided in a format defined by NTCIP 1202 v03B.
NTCIP_1218-898

3.5.1.5 Manage Location Corrections Requirements
NTCIP_1218-899

The requirements for managing location corrections data provided by the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-900
3.5.1.5.1 Forward Location Corrections Data
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1630 Immediate Forward Table
NTCIP_1218-1633 Forward Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1634 Forward Message PSID
NTCIP_1218-1635 Forward Message Transmission Channel
NTCIP_1218-1636 Forward Message Enable
NTCIP_1218-1637 Forward Message Status
NTCIP_1218-1640 Forward Message Payload
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-342 Manage Location Corrections
NTCIP_1218-901

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall forward location corrections data received from an external source for transmission via the V2X interface. Examples of location corrections data are RTCM Corrections messages as recommended in SAE J2735.
NTCIP_1218-902
3.5.1.5.2 Use RTCM Corrections Data
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1630 Immediate Forward Table
NTCIP_1218-1633 Forward Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1634 Forward Message PSID
NTCIP_1218-1635 Forward Message Transmission Channel
NTCIP_1218-1636 Forward Message Enable
NTCIP_1218-1637 Forward Message Status
NTCIP_1218-1640 Forward Message Payload
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-342 Manage Location Corrections
NTCIP_1218-903

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall receive and transmit the RTCM SC-104 Corrections messages received from a validated external source.
NTCIP_1218-904

3.5.2 RSU Monitoring Requirements
NTCIP_1218-905

The requirements for monitoring the operation of the RSU device follow.
NTCIP_1218-906

3.5.2.1 Determine RSU Operational Performance Status Requirements
NTCIP_1218-907

The requirements for monitoring the operational performance for the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-908
3.5.2.1.1 Report Time Elapsed Since RSU Power On
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1788 Time Since RSU Powered On
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-346 Determine RSU Operational Performance St…
NTCIP_1218-909

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the amount of time that has elapsed since it has been powered on, in seconds.
NTCIP_1218-910
3.5.2.1.2 Report Amount of Free Memory
Satisfied by:
UCD_SNMP-79 The total amount of memory free or avail…
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-346 Determine RSU Operational Performance St…
NTCIP_1218-911

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the amount of free volatile memory, in megabytes, available on the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-912
3.5.2.1.3 Report Instantaneous CPU Load
Satisfied by:
UCD_SNMP-161 The percentage of CPU time spent process…
UCD_SNMP-162 The percentage of CPU time spent process…
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-346 Determine RSU Operational Performance St…
NTCIP_1218-913

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the CPU load of the RSU at the time of the request, in percentage, from 0 to 100 percent.
NTCIP_1218-914
3.5.2.1.4 Report CPU Load Average - 15 Minutes
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
UCD_SNMP-119 Load average information.
UCD_SNMP-124 The 1,5 and 15 minute load averages (one…
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-20 Report CPU Load Average - 15 Minutes
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-346 Determine RSU Operational Performance St…
NTCIP_1218-915

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the average CPU load of the RSU for the previous 15 minutes, in percentage, from 0 to 100 percent.
NTCIP_1218-916
3.5.2.1.5 Report CPU Load Average - 5 Minutes
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
UCD_SNMP-119 Load average information.
UCD_SNMP-124 The 1,5 and 15 minute load averages (one…
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-21 Report CPU Load Average - 5 Minutes
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-346 Determine RSU Operational Performance St…
NTCIP_1218-917

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the average CPU load of the RSU for the previous 5 minutes, in percentage, from 0 to 100 percent.
NTCIP_1218-918
3.5.2.1.6 Report CPU Load Average - 1 Minute
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
UCD_SNMP-119 Load average information.
UCD_SNMP-124 The 1,5 and 15 minute load averages (one…
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-22 Report CPU Load Average - 1 Minute
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-346 Determine RSU Operational Performance St…
NTCIP_1218-919

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the average CPU load of the RSU for the previous minute, in percentage, from 0 to 100 percent.
NTCIP_1218-920
3.5.2.1.7 Report Storage Space Available
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
UCD_SNMP-98 Disk watching information. Partions to b…
UCD_SNMP-107 Available space on the disk. For large l…
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-23 Report Storage Space Available
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-346 Determine RSU Operational Performance St…
NTCIP_1218-921

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the amount of non-volatile available storage space, in megabytes. The storage space in the RSU may be used to store interface data logs, applications, etc.
NTCIP_1218-922
3.5.2.1.8 Report Number of Messages Exchanged
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1201 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Dynamic …
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1777 RSU Message Count Table
NTCIP_1218-1780 RSU Message Counter Index
NTCIP_1218-1781 RSU Message Counter Provider Service Ide…
NTCIP_1218-1782 RSU Message Counter Channel
NTCIP_1218-1783 RSU Message Counter Direction
NTCIP_1218-1784 RSU Message Start Time
NTCIP_1218-1785 RSU Message Counter
NTCIP_1218-1786 RSU Message Counter Status
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-346 Determine RSU Operational Performance St…
NTCIP_1218-356 Report Number of Messages Exchanged
NTCIP_1218-923

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the number of messages transmitted and received over the V2X interface, sorted by channel and direction (transmitted or received), since the RSU was last rebooted or since the time the RSU was commanded to begin tracking the number of messages exchanged.
NTCIP_1218-924
3.5.2.1.9 Determine Maximum Number of Monitored PSID Messages
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1776 Maximum Number of Message Counts by PSID
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-356 Report Number of Messages Exchanged
NTCIP_1218-925

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the number of PSIDs that can be monitored for the number of messages exchanged over the V2X interface, by channel and direction (transmitted or received).
NTCIP_1218-926

3.5.2.2 Report Mode of Operations
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1864 RSU Mode Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-348 Determine Mode of Operations
NTCIP_1218-927

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current mode of operation of the RSU. Valid values are standby, operate, and fault.
NTCIP_1218-928

In 'standby' mode, the RSU's V2X radio is not enabled and interface logging is disabled.
NTCIP_1218-929

The RSU is in 'operate' mode when V2X radio is enabled (transmitting and receiving), system logging is enabled, and periodic communications with a management station (e.g., an operations center) is enabled.
NTCIP_1218-930

In 'fault' mode, the RSU is not fully functional, only minimally responsive and is not transmitting messages over the V2X interface. For example, the RSU may enter fault mode if the RSU fails to properly reboot (e.g., all system drivers or firmware do not properly start) after a configurable number of attempts.
NTCIP_1218-931

3.5.2.3 Determine RSU Clock Status Requirements
NTCIP_1218-932

The requirements for managing the clock of an RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-933
3.5.2.3.1 Report RSU Clock Source
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1866 RSU Clock Source
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-350 Determine RSU Clock Status
NTCIP_1218-934

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the primary clock source for the RSU. The valid values are crystal, GNSS, NTP, and other.
NTCIP_1218-935
3.5.2.3.2 Report RSU Clock Status
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1867 RSU Clock Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-350 Determine RSU Clock Status
NTCIP_1218-936

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the status of the system clock in the RSU. The valid values are active and pending update.
NTCIP_1218-937
3.5.2.3.3 Store Allowable RSU Clock Source Timeout
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1868 RSU Clock Source Timeout
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-350 Determine RSU Clock Status
NTCIP_1218-938

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store a timeout value, from 1 to 3,600 seconds, representing the allowable amount of time that communications from the primary time source may be lost.
NTCIP_1218-939
3.5.2.3.4 Store Allowable RSU Clock Source Queries
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1869 RSU Clock Source Queries
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-350 Determine RSU Clock Status
NTCIP_1218-940

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the number of allowable consecutive failed query attempts, from 1 to 15, for time information from the primary time source.
NTCIP_1218-941
3.5.2.3.5 Store Allowable Time Deviation
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1870 RSU Clock Deviation Tolerance
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-350 Determine RSU Clock Status
NTCIP_1218-942

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the allowable deviation, in milliseconds, between two or more time sources.
NTCIP_1218-943
3.5.2.3.6 Enable/Disable NTP Server
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1932 NTP Service Enable
Conditionally meets:
NTCIP_1218-350 Determine RSU Clock Status
NTCIP_1218-944

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store whether the NTP server is enabled or disabled. This requirement allows the RSU to be an NTP server if the RSU is connected to a precise time source, such as GNSS.
NTCIP_1218-945

3.5.2.4 Determine RSU Location Requirements
NTCIP_1218-946

The requirements for the RSU to determine its location information follow.
NTCIP_1218-947
3.5.2.4.1 Report RSU Location
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1664 GNSS Reported Latitude
NTCIP_1218-1665 GNSS Reported Longitude
NTCIP_1218-1666 GNSS Reported Elevation
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-289 Manage RSU Location Information
NTCIP_1218-352 Determine RSU Location
NTCIP_1218-948

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall return its current location as reported by a GNSS or similar geopositioning device. The RSU location consists of the latitude, longitude, and elevation. The latitude and longitude are measured in tenths of a microdegrees (10^-7 degrees) based on the WGS-84 (World Geodetic System 1984). The elevation of the RSU is in centimeters above the reference ellipsoid as defined by WGS-84 and is measured to the base of the GNSS antenna.
NTCIP_1218-949

Note: For locations where GNSS signals are not sufficient to report its current location (e.g., in a long tunnel), the forthcoming Side Link Syncronization Service (SLSS) specified in J3161 and J3161/1 is supposed to solve this issue.
NTCIP_1218-950
3.5.2.4.2 Report Positioning Status
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1608 GNSS Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-352 Determine RSU Location
NTCIP_1218-951

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall return the number of satellites, from 0 to 15, the GNSS or similar geopositioning device is tracking.
NTCIP_1218-952
3.5.2.4.3 Store Allowable RSU Location Tolerance
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1667 GNSS Allowable Location Deviation
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-352 Determine RSU Location
NTCIP_1218-953

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the maximum allowable tolerance, in centimeters, between the last location reported by a GNSS or similar geopositioning device and the RSU's reference location. The tolerance is reported as the distance between the two coordinates (longitude and latitude), from 1 to 20,000 meters. This requirement is used by the RSU to determine if a notification should be transmitted to a management station.
NTCIP_1218-954
3.5.2.4.4 Report RSU Location Deviation
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1668 GNSS Location Deviation
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-352 Determine RSU Location
NTCIP_1218-955

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the deviation, in centimeters, between the location reported by a GNSS or similar geopositioning device and the RSU's reference location.
NTCIP_1218-956
3.5.2.4.5 Report RSU Estimated Location Error
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1669 RSU Position Error
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-352 Determine RSU Location
NTCIP_1218-957

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the estimated location error the GNSS or similar geopositioning device is experiencing. The estimated location error is defined along the semi-major axis, semi-minor axis, and orientation, as defined by DF_PositionalAccuracy in SAE J2735.
NTCIP_1218-958

3.5.2.5 Monitor Network Interface Requirements
NTCIP_1218-959

The requirements for the RSU to monitor its network interfaces follow.
NTCIP_1218-960
3.5.2.5.1 Monitor Data Link Errors - Ethernet
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
rfc3635-10 Statistics for a collection of ethernet-…
rfc3635-13 An index value that uniquely identifies …
rfc3635-14 A count of frames received on a particul…
rfc3635-15 A count of frames received on a particul…
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-354 Monitor Network Interfaces
NTCIP_1218-961

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall return the number of communications errors that have occurred on an Ethernet port. Communications errors include a bad CRC and framing errors resulting in a corrupted message.
NTCIP_1218-962

3.5.2.6 Report Number of Messages Exchanged by V2X Radio and PSID
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1201 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Dynamic …
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1777 RSU Message Count Table
NTCIP_1218-1780 RSU Message Counter Index
NTCIP_1218-1781 RSU Message Counter Provider Service Ide…
NTCIP_1218-1782 RSU Message Counter Channel
NTCIP_1218-1783 RSU Message Counter Direction
NTCIP_1218-1784 RSU Message Start Time
NTCIP_1218-1785 RSU Message Counter
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-356 Report Number of Messages Exchanged
NTCIP_1218-963

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall report the number of messages transmitted and received by the RSU, sorted by PSID and V2X radio, over the radio since the RSU was last powered on or the RSU was rebooted. If the application is IP-based, the RSU stores the number of messages comprising the entire corresponding data exchange.
NTCIP_1218-964

3.5.2.7 Determine Number of Active Radios
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1179 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Static T…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1592 Maximum Radios
NTCIP_1218-1593 Radio Table
NTCIP_1218-1596 RSU Radio Index
NTCIP_1218-1598 RSU Radio Enable
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-358 Determine Number of Active Radios
NTCIP_1218-965

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report which V2X radios are active.
NTCIP_1218-966

3.5.2.8 Determine RF Communications Range Requirements
NTCIP_1218-967

Requirements to determine the effective RF communications range for V2X communications around the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-968
3.5.2.8.1 Determine Maximum Number of Communications Range Entries
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1792 Maximum Number of Communications Range E…
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-360 Determine RF Communications Range
NTCIP_1218-969

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall report the maximum number of communications range entries that can be supported on the RSU. Each entry represents the communications range statistics based on a message type, a vehicle type or vehicle class, and one or more of 16 22.5 degree sectors.
NTCIP_1218-970
3.5.2.8.2 Report the RF Communications Distance - 1 Minute
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1201 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Dynamic …
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1793 RSU Communications Range Table
NTCIP_1218-1796 RSU Communications Range Index
NTCIP_1218-1797 RSU Communications Range - Geographic Se…
NTCIP_1218-1798 RSU Communications Range - Message Type
NTCIP_1218-1799 RSU Communications Range - Filter Type
NTCIP_1218-1800 RSU Communications Range - Filter Value
NTCIP_1218-1801 RSU Communications Range - 1 Minute
NTCIP_1218-1807 RSU Communications Range Status
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-360 Determine RF Communications Range
NTCIP_1218-971

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the farthest distance, in meters, from the location of the RSU by sector that a message was received via the V2X interface over the previous 1 minute by message type and vehicle type. This requirement allows an RSU to determine the radio coverage in each of 16 22.5 degree sectors around the RSU. The first sector starts from North and ends at 22.5 degrees from North in an eastward direction and the distance is measured in tenths of a meter. The message type is identified by the DE_DSRC_MessageID data element, as defined in SAE J2735. The vehicle type is defined by DE_VehicleType, as defined in SAE J2735, which represents the FHWA 13-Vehicle Category Classification. A distance of 0 meters indicates no messages are received.
NTCIP_1218-972
3.5.2.8.3 Report the RF Communications Distance - 5 Minutes
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1201 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Dynamic …
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1793 RSU Communications Range Table
NTCIP_1218-1796 RSU Communications Range Index
NTCIP_1218-1797 RSU Communications Range - Geographic Se…
NTCIP_1218-1798 RSU Communications Range - Message Type
NTCIP_1218-1799 RSU Communications Range - Filter Type
NTCIP_1218-1800 RSU Communications Range - Filter Value
NTCIP_1218-1802 RSU Communications Range - 5 Minute
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-360 Determine RF Communications Range
NTCIP_1218-973

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the farthest distance, in meters, from the location of the RSU by sector that a message was received via the V2X interface over the previous 5 minutes by message type and vehicle type. This requirement allows an RSU to determine the radio coverage in each of sixteen 22.5 degree sectors around the RSU. The first sector starts from North and ends at 22.5 degrees from North in an eastward direction and the distance is measured in tenths of a meter. The message type is identified by the DE_DSRC_MessageID data element, as defined in SAE J2735. The vehicle type is defined by DE_VehicleType, as defined in SAE J2735, which represents the FHWA 13-Vehicle Category Classification. A distance of 0 meters indicates no messages are received.
NTCIP_1218-974
3.5.2.8.4 Report the RF Communications Distance - 15 Minutes
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1201 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Dynamic …
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1793 RSU Communications Range Table
NTCIP_1218-1796 RSU Communications Range Index
NTCIP_1218-1797 RSU Communications Range - Geographic Se…
NTCIP_1218-1798 RSU Communications Range - Message Type
NTCIP_1218-1799 RSU Communications Range - Filter Type
NTCIP_1218-1800 RSU Communications Range - Filter Value
NTCIP_1218-1803 RSU Communications Range - 15 Minute
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-360 Determine RF Communications Range
NTCIP_1218-975

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the farthest distance, in meters, from the location of the RSU by sector that a message was received via the V2X interface over the previous 15 minutes by message type and vehicle type. This requirement allows an RSU to determine the radio coverage in each of 16 22.5 degree sectors around the RSU. The first sector starts from North and ends at 22.5 degrees from North in an eastward direction and the distance is measured in tenths of a meter. The message type is identified by the DE_DSRC_MessageID data element, as defined in SAE J2735. The vehicle type is defined by DE_VehicleType, as defined in SAE J2735, which represents the FHWA 13-Vehicle Category Classification. A distance of 0 meters indicates no messages are received.
NTCIP_1218-976
3.5.2.8.5 Report the Average RF Communications Distance - 1 Minute
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1201 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Dynamic …
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1793 RSU Communications Range Table
NTCIP_1218-1796 RSU Communications Range Index
NTCIP_1218-1797 RSU Communications Range - Geographic Se…
NTCIP_1218-1798 RSU Communications Range - Message Type
NTCIP_1218-1799 RSU Communications Range - Filter Type
NTCIP_1218-1800 RSU Communications Range - Filter Value
NTCIP_1218-1804 RSU Average Communications Range - 1 Min…
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-360 Determine RF Communications Range
NTCIP_1218-977

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the average farthest distance from the location of the RSU by sector from which a message was received via the V2X interface over the previous 1 minute by message type and vehicle type. This requirement assumes that the RSU has the ability to determine when a mobile device is first or last detected by the RSU within a sector. This calculation is a simple average of the location of each mobile device detected by the RSU in the previous 1 minute. This requirement allows an RSU to determine the radio coverage in each of 16 22.5 degree sectors around the RSU. The first sector starts from North and ends at 22.5 degrees from North in an eastward direction and the distance is measured in tenths of a meter. The message type is identified by the DE_DSRC_MessageID data element, as defined in SAE J2735. The vehicle type is defined by DE_VehicleType, as defined in SAE J2735, which represents the FHWA 13-Vehicle Category Classification. A distance of 0 meters indicates no messages are received.
NTCIP_1218-978
3.5.2.8.6 Report the Average RF Communications Distance - 5 Minutes
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1201 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Dynamic …
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1793 RSU Communications Range Table
NTCIP_1218-1796 RSU Communications Range Index
NTCIP_1218-1797 RSU Communications Range - Geographic Se…
NTCIP_1218-1798 RSU Communications Range - Message Type
NTCIP_1218-1799 RSU Communications Range - Filter Type
NTCIP_1218-1800 RSU Communications Range - Filter Value
NTCIP_1218-1805 RSU Average Communications Range - 5 Min…
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-360 Determine RF Communications Range
NTCIP_1218-979

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the average farthest distance from the location of the RSU by sector from which a message was received via the V2X interface over the previous 5 minutes by message type and vehicle type. This requirement assumes that the RSU has the ability to determine when a mobile device is first or last detected by the RSU within a sector. This calculation is a simple average of the location of each mobile device detected by the RSU in the previous 5 minutes. This requirement allows an RSU to determine the radio coverage in each of 16 22.5 degree sectors around the RSU. The first sector starts from North and ends at 22.5 degrees from North in an eastward direction and the distance is measured in tenths of a meter. The message type is identified by the DE_DSRC_MessageID data element, as defined in SAE J2735. The vehicle type is defined by DE_VehicleType, as defined in SAE J2735, which represents the FHWA 13-Vehicle Category Classification. A distance of 0 meters indicates no messages are received.
NTCIP_1218-980
