3.5.2.8.7 Report the Average RF Communications Distance - 15 Minutes
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1201 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Dynamic …
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1793 RSU Communications Range Table
NTCIP_1218-1796 RSU Communications Range Index
NTCIP_1218-1797 RSU Communications Range - Geographic Se…
NTCIP_1218-1798 RSU Communications Range - Message Type
NTCIP_1218-1799 RSU Communications Range - Filter Type
NTCIP_1218-1800 RSU Communications Range - Filter Value
NTCIP_1218-1806 RSU Average Communications Range - 15 Mi…
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-360 Determine RF Communications Range
NTCIP_1218-981

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the average farthest distance from the location of the RSU by sector from which a message was received via the V2X interface over the previous 15 minutes by message type and vehicle type. This requirement assumes that the RSU has the ability to determine when a mobile device is first or last detected by the RSU within a sector. This calculation is a simple average of the location of each mobile device detected by the RSU in the previous 15 minutes. This requirement allows an RSU to determine the radio coverage in each of 16 22.5 degree sectors around the RSU. The first sector starts from North and ends at 22.5 degrees from North in an eastward direction and the distance is measured in tenths of a meter. The message type is identified by the DE_DSRC_MessageID data element, as defined in SAE J2735. The vehicle type is defined by DE_VehicleType, as defined in SAE J2735, which represents the FHWA 13-Vehicle Category Classification. A distance of 0 meters indicates no messages are received.
NTCIP_1218-982
3.5.2.8.8 Manage RF Communications Range Statistics
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1793 RSU Communications Range Table
NTCIP_1218-1796 RSU Communications Range Index
NTCIP_1218-1797 RSU Communications Range - Geographic Se…
NTCIP_1218-1798 RSU Communications Range - Message Type
NTCIP_1218-1799 RSU Communications Range - Filter Type
NTCIP_1218-1800 RSU Communications Range - Filter Value
NTCIP_1218-1807 RSU Communications Range Status
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-360 Determine RF Communications Range
NTCIP_1218-983

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the parameters for measuring the farthest and average farthest distance a message was received via the V2X interface over a predefined period (1-, 5-, and 15- minutes). Each set of parameters consists of a message type, a vehicle type or vehicle class, and one or more of 16 22.5 degree sectors.
NTCIP_1218-984

3.5.2.9 Determine Application Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1911 RSU Application Configuration Table
NTCIP_1218-1914 Application Configuration ID Parameter
NTCIP_1218-1917 Application Configuration State
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-362 Determine Application Status
NTCIP_1218-985

Upon request by a management station, the RSU shall report the status of an application on the RSU. The status of the application is defined by if the application is active or not.
NTCIP_1218-986

3.5.2.10 Retrieve Configuration Parameters Requirements
NTCIP_1218-987

Requirements for retrieving the configuration parameters for the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-988
3.5.2.10.1 Report the Internal Operating Temperature
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1789 RSU Internal Temperature
Conditionally meets:
NTCIP_1218-364 Determine RSU Environment
NTCIP_1218-989

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the internal temperature of the RSU enclosure in degrees Celsius. The valid values are from -100 to 100 degrees Celsius, and an additional value indicating unknown temperature.
NTCIP_1218-990
3.5.2.10.2 Determine the Internal Operating Temperature Thresholds
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1790 RSU Internal Temperature - Low Temperatu…
NTCIP_1218-1791 RSU Internal Temperature - High Tempera…
Conditionally meets:
NTCIP_1218-364 Determine RSU Environment
NTCIP_1218-991

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the internal temperature thresholds for the RSU enclosure in degrees Celsius. The valid values are from -100 to 100 degrees Celsius, and an additional value indicating unknown temperature. The RSU is to transmit a notification if the internal temperature exceeds the temperature thresholds.
NTCIP_1218-992

3.5.2.11 Report RSU Current Status Requirements
NTCIP_1218-993

The requirements to report the current status of the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-994
3.5.2.11.1 Report RSU Current Overall Status
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1871 RSU System Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-995

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the overall summary current state of the RSU. Valid values are okay, warning, critical, and unknown. Okay indicates the RSU fully operational with no errors detected that impacts its operation, i.e., all services provided by the RSU are okay. Warning indicates the RSU is operating, but an issue is detected which may affect its operation, e.g., wrong configuration, firewall not active. Critical indicates an error that has a significant impact on the RSU operation, e.g., time source lost or a service crashed.
NTCIP_1218-996
3.5.2.11.2 Report RSU Services Status Requirements
NTCIP_1218-997

The requirements to retrieve the status of services provided by the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-998
3.5.2.11.2.1 Report RSU System Services Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1927 Service Name
NTCIP_1218-1928 Service Status
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-24 Report RSU System Services Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-999

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current state of the system services on the RSU. System services include CPU usage and memory usage. Valid values are okay, warning, critical, and unknown. Okay indicates the system services is fully operational with no errors detected that impacts its operation. Warning indicates the system services is operational, but an error is detected which may affect its operation, e.g., low system memory available. Critical indicates an error is detected that has a significant impact on the RSU operation, e.g., no system memory available.
NTCIP_1218-1000
3.5.2.11.2.2 Report GNSS Service Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1927 Service Name
NTCIP_1218-1928 Service Status
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-25 Report GNSS Service Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1001

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current state of the GNSS service on the RSU. Valid values are okay, warning, critical, and unknown. Okay indicates the GNSS service is fully functional with no errors detected. Warning indicates the GNSS service is operational, but an issue is detected which may affect its operation, e.g., poor signal strength, signal from less than five satellites available. Critical indicates an error is detected that has a significant impact on the RSU operation, e.g., no GNSS signal detected.
NTCIP_1218-1002
3.5.2.11.2.3 Report Time Service Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1927 Service Name
NTCIP_1218-1928 Service Status
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-26 Report Time Service Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1003

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current state of the time source on the RSU. Valid values are okay, warning, critical, and unknown. Okay indicates the RSU's primary time source is fully operational with no errors detected. Warning indicates that an issue with the time source is detected, which may affect RSU operations, e.g., non-primary time source not detected, no valid time data from the primary time source but secondary time source is available, or tolerable deviation between two or more different time sources detected. Critical indicates an error is detected that has a significant impact on the RSU operation, e.g., primary clock source timeout and no other time source available.
NTCIP_1218-1004
3.5.2.11.2.4 Report Storage Service Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1927 Service Name
NTCIP_1218-1928 Service Status
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-27 Report Storage Service Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1005

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current state of the storage available for storing logs on the RSU. Valid values are okay, warning, critical, and unknown. Okay indicates that sufficient storage is available for storing new log data, including removable storage (e.g., SD card). Warning indicates the available storage may be insufficient based on the current calculated storage needs. The Warning threshold may be vendor-defined or agency-defined but should be based on what the expected storage needs when considering what logging is currently enabled or scheduled. Critical indicates that no storage is available for saving logged data on the RSU (even if the RSU is writing over older log files).
NTCIP_1218-1006
3.5.2.11.2.5 Report Access Control Service Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1927 Service Name
NTCIP_1218-1928 Service Status
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-28 Report Access Control Service Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1007

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current state of the access control (e.g., firewall) service on the RSU. Valid values are okay, warning, critical, and unknown. Okay indicates the access control service is fully operational with no errors detected. Warning indicates the access control service is operating, but an issue is detected which may compromise security, e.g., a potentially unauthorized request is detected. Critical indicates an error is detected that may comprise RSU security, e.g., the access control service has timed out.
NTCIP_1218-1008
3.5.2.11.2.6 Report Network Service Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1927 Service Name
NTCIP_1218-1928 Service Status
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-29 Report Network Service Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1009

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current state of the network services on the RSU. Valid values are okay, warning, citical, and unknown. Okay indicates the network services are fully operational with no errors detected. Warning indicates that an issue is detected with the network which may affect RSU operations, e.g., communications timeout. Critical indicates an error is detected that has a significant impact on the RSU operation, e.g., communications timeout with a management station.
NTCIP_1218-1010
3.5.2.11.2.7 Report Radio Access Service Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1927 Service Name
NTCIP_1218-1928 Service Status
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-30 Report Radio Access Service Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1011

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current state of the radio access services, such as layers 1 and 2 of the radio access technology, on the RSU. Valid values are okay, warning, critical, and unknown. Okay indicates the radio services are fully operational with no errors detected. Warning indicates the radio access services are operating, but an issue is detected which may affect its operation. Critical indicates an error that has a significant impact on the RSU operation, e.g., the RSU has insufficient precision timing to perform alternating radio mode or no response from the V2X radio.
NTCIP_1218-1012
3.5.2.11.2.8 Report V2X Radio Networking Services Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1927 Service Name
NTCIP_1218-1928 Service Status
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-31 Report V2X Radio Networking Services Sta…
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1013

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current state of the V2X radio networking services, such as layers 3 and 4 of the radio access technology on the RSU. For DSRC radios, this represents IEEE 1609.3. Valid values are okay, warning, critical and unknown. Okay indicates the radio networking services are fully operational with no errors detected. Warning indicates the radio networking services are operating, but an issue is detected which may affect its operation, e.g., wrong configuration. Critical indicates an error that has a significant impact on the RSU operation, e.g., the Ethernet interface is down or the DNS is unavailable.
NTCIP_1218-1014
3.5.2.11.2.9 Report IEEE 1609.2 Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1927 Service Name
NTCIP_1218-1928 Service Status
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-32 Report IEEE 1609.2 Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1015

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current state of IEEE 1609.2 certificates on the RSU. Valid values are okay, warning, critical, and unknown. Okay indicates the status of the IEEE 1609.2 certificates is fully operational with no errors detected. Warning indicates the services that use IEEE 1609.2 certificates are operational, but an issue is detected which may affect its operation, e.g., the number of valid IEEE 1609.2 certificates are low, or there is an IEEE 1609.2 application certificate expiring within 7 days. Critical indicates an error that has a significant impact on the RSU operation, e.g., no more valid IEEE 1609.2 certificates are available.
NTCIP_1218-1016
3.5.2.11.2.10 Report SCMS Service Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1927 Service Name
NTCIP_1218-1928 Service Status
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-33 Report SCMS Service Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1017

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current state of the SCMS service on the RSU. Valid values are okay, warning, critical, and unknown. Okay indicates the SCMS service is fully operational with no errors detected. Warning indicates the SCMS service is operating, but an issue is detected which may affect its operation, e.g., the enrollment certificates are expiring within 7 days. Critical indicates an error is detected that has a significant impact on the RSU operation, e.g., the enrollment certificates are invalid.
NTCIP_1218-1018
3.5.2.11.2.11 Report Vendor Specific Services Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1201 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Dynamic …
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1926 Service ID Parameter
NTCIP_1218-1927 Service Name
NTCIP_1218-1928 Service Status
NTCIP_1218-1931 Service Row Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1019

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current state of vendor specific services on the RSU. Valid values are okay, warning, critical, and unknown. Okay indicates the vendor specific service is operating properly with no errors detected and that impacts its operation. Warning indicates the vendor specific service is operating, but an issue is detected which may affect its operation. Critical indicates the vendor specific service may not be operating or an error is detected that has a significant impact on the RSU operation.
NTCIP_1218-1020
3.5.2.11.2.12 Report RSU Services Description
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1201 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Dynamic …
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1926 Service ID Parameter
NTCIP_1218-1929 Service Status Description
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1021

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report a detailed description of the cause of the current status of an RSU service. For example, the description may describe what event caused an RSU service to have a current state of Critical.
NTCIP_1218-1022
3.5.2.11.2.13 Report RSU Services Status Update Time
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1201 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Dynamic …
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1926 Service ID Parameter
NTCIP_1218-1930 Service Status Update TIme
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1023

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the date and time the current state of a RSU was last updated. This requirement allows a transportation operator to determine when an event that caused the service to enter a Warning or Critical state occurred.
NTCIP_1218-1024
3.5.2.11.2.14 Report NTP Server Service Status
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1191 Generic Retrieve Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1923 RSU Services Table
NTCIP_1218-1927 Service Name
NTCIP_1218-1928 Service Status
Satisfied with note by:
Notes-34 Report NTP Server Service Status
Conditionally meets:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1025

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current state of the NTP Server service on the RSU. The NTP service allows the RSU to be a NTPv4 compliant server, as defined in RFC 5905. Valid values are okay, warning, critical, and unknown. Okay indicates the NTP service is fully operational with no errors detected. Warning indicates the NTP service is operating, but an issue is detected which may affect its operation, e.g., the RSU has not received a valid time update from the primary time source in 1 second. Critical indicates an error is detected that has a significant impact on the RSU operation, e.g., the RSU has not received a valid time update from the primary time source that exceeds the timeout period (See 3.5.2.3.3).
NTCIP_1218-1026

Note: This requirement is mandatory if the RSU is to be a NTPv4 compliant server.
NTCIP_1218-1027
3.5.2.11.2.15 Report NTP Server Status
Satisfied by:
rfc5907-24 The current mode of the NTP. The definit…
Conditionally meets:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1028

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the current mode of the NTP, as defined in RFC 5907.
NTCIP_1218-1029
3.5.2.11.2.16 Determine Maximum Number of Services Supported
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1922 Maximum RSU Service Entries
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-366 Determine RSU Current Status
NTCIP_1218-1030

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the maximum number of services supported by the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-1031

3.5.3 RSU Control Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1032

The requirements for controlling the RSU device follow.
NTCIP_1218-1033

3.5.3.1 Control Mode of Operation
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1863 RSU Mode
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-370 Control Mode of Operation
NTCIP_1218-1034

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall change its mode of operation as requested. Valid modes of operation are fully operational, and standby mode.
NTCIP_1218-1035

3.5.3.2 Control RF Antenna Output
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1195 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1852 Antenna Table
NTCIP_1218-1855 RSU Antenna Index
NTCIP_1218-1859 RSU Antenna Gain
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-372 Control RF Antenna Output
NTCIP_1218-1036

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall set the transmit power of a RF channel as effective isotropic radiated power (EIRP), in dBm. The transmit power is required to comply with the appropriate regulatory domain.
NTCIP_1218-1037

3.5.3.3 Reboot RSU
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1865 RSU Reboot
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-374 Reboot RSU
NTCIP_1218-1038

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall (warm) reboot the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-1039

3.5.3.4 Control Application
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1849 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter
NTCIP_1218-1911 RSU Application Configuration Table
NTCIP_1218-1914 Application Configuration ID Parameter
NTCIP_1218-1918 Application Configuration Start Command …
NTCIP_1218-1919 Application Configuration Stop Command P…
NTCIP_1218-1920 Application Configuration Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-376 Control Application
NTCIP_1218-1040

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall enable or disable an application (process) on the RSU.
NTCIP_1218-1041

3.5.3.5 Configure RSU Reboot
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1873 RSU Reboot Setting
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-374 Reboot RSU
NTCIP_1218-1042

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store if the RSU uses the last saved value, or the user-configured default settings upon (warm) rebooting the RSU. See CTI 4001, Section 3.3.2.2.
NTCIP_1218-1043

3.5.3.6 Support Diagnostic Mode
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1847 Diagnostic Signing
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-370 Control Mode of Operation
NTCIP_1218-1044

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall enable or disable signing messages, which would otherwise be signed by the RSU based on other settings. When disabled, the RSU transmits all WAVE messages with the IEEE Std 1609.2™ header Ieee1609Dot2Data.unsecuredData.
NTCIP_1218-1045

To prevent potential abuse, the RSU will always restart in a state so the RSU is signing messages (i.e., diagnostic mode has to be manually re-enabled to disable signing messages).
NTCIP_1218-1046

3.5.3.7 Configure Diagnostic Mode Limit
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1848 Diagnostic Signing Duration
Conditionally meets:
NTCIP_1218-370 Control Mode of Operation
NTCIP_1218-1047

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the time duration, in hours, that the RSU may remain in a diagnostic mode. This requirement enhances security of the V2X environment (number of unsigned messages) and reduces the likelihood of an RSU inadvertently flooding the V2X environment with unsigned messages.
NTCIP_1218-1048

3.5.4 Security Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1049

The requirements to configure and monitor security for the RSU follows.
NTCIP_1218-1050

3.5.4.1 Configure Security Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1051

The requirements to configure and monitor security for the RSU follows.
NTCIP_1218-1052
3.5.4.1.1 Configure Authentication Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1053

The requirements to configure authentication for the RSU follows.
NTCIP_1218-1054
3.5.4.1.1.1 Report Valid Geographic Region - Enrollment Certificates
2024-07-22: Kenneth Vaughn

To distinguish from 3.5.4.1.1.2, add " - Country Code" to the end of the heading
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1690 Enrollment Certificate Valid Region
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-388 Manage Authentication
NTCIP_1218-1055

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the valid geographic region within which the RSU is allowed to procure enrollment certificates. Enrollment certificates may define a geographic region within which the certificate is valid. This requirement allows the RSU to report the valid geographic region by country code. The country code is defined by the United Nations M49 standard. The country code for the United States is 840. Note: the M49 standard is the same as the ISO 3166 except some countries are omitted from the M49 standard.
2024-07-22: Kenneth Vaughn

"enrollment certificates" is too vague. Replace with "IEEE 1609.2 enrollment certificates" or similar.

Also, the first sentence should be updated to be consistent with the remainder of the requirement. Modify the ending of the first sentence by adding "by country code".
NTCIP_1218-1056

Note: The requirement was updated slightly in NTCIP 1218 v01A to be consistent with the design in NTCIP 1218 v01, which is rsuSecEnrollCertValidRegion.
NTCIP_1218-1057
3.5.4.1.1.2 Report Valid Geographic Region - Enrollment Certificates – Circular Region
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1717 Enrollment Certificate Valid Region - La…
NTCIP_1218-1718 Enrollment Certificate Valid Region - La…
NTCIP_1218-1719 Enrollment Certificate Valid Region - Ra…
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-388 Manage Authentication
NTCIP_1218-1058

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the valid geographic region within which the RSU is allowed to procure enrollment certificates by country code. Enrollment certificates may define a geographic region within which the certificate is valid. This requirement allows the RSU to report the valid geographic region, which is within the radius of the RSU's location in meters, so the RSU may request, receive, and store an enrollment certificate with the appropriate geographic region.
2024-07-22: Kenneth Vaughn

"enrollment certificates" is too vague. Replace with "IEEE 1609.2 enrollment certificates" or similar.

The first sentence needs to be updated to be consistent with the remainder of the requirement. Replace the ending of the first sentence with "by defining a circular region".
NTCIP_1218-1059

3.5.4.2 Monitor Availability Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1060

The requirements to monitor for availability failures for the RSU follows.
NTCIP_1218-1061
3.5.4.2.1 Report Expiration Date - Enrollment Certificates
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1693 Enrollment Certificate Expiration
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-392 Manage Availability
NTCIP_1218-1062

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the number of days before the existing enrollment certificate on the RSU expire. This requirement indicates if the RSU needs to request a new enrollment certificate. A value of 0 indicates the certificates expire that day but have not expired yet. A value of 65535 indicates the certificates have expired. A value of 65534 indicates the expiration dates are 65534 days or longer.
NTCIP_1218-1063
3.5.4.2.2 Report Expiration Date - Application Certificates
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1179 Generic Retrieve Table Dialog - Static T…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1696 Maximum Application Certificates
NTCIP_1218-1697 Application Certificate Table
NTCIP_1218-1700 Application Certificate Index
NTCIP_1218-1701 Application Certificate PSID
NTCIP_1218-1703 Application Certificate Expiration
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-392 Manage Availability
NTCIP_1218-1064

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall report the number of hours before the existing application certificates on the RSU expire. This requirement indicates if the RSU needs to request new application certificates. A value of 0 indicates the certificates expire that day but have not expired yet. A value of 255 indicates the certificates have expired. A value of 254 indicates the expiration dates are 254 hours or longer.
NTCIP_1218-1065

3.5.5 Backward Compatibility Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1066

The following defines the requirements for backward compatibility.
NTCIP_1218-1067

3.5.5.1 Backward Compatibility – NTCIP 1218 v01 Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1068

The following defines the requirements for backward compatibility with NTCIP 1218 v01.
NTCIP_1218-1069
3.5.5.1.1 NTCIP 1218 v01 – Store a Message
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1215 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dyn…
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1612 Store and Repeat Table
NTCIP_1218-1615 Stored Message Index
NTCIP_1218-1616 Stored Message PSID
NTCIP_1218-1617 Stored Message Transmission Channel
NTCIP_1218-1618 Stored Message Transmission Interval
NTCIP_1218-1621 Stored Message Payload
NTCIP_1218-1623 Stored Message Status
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-384 Backward Compatible with NTCIP 1218 v01
NTCIP_1218-1070

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store a message for future transmission in the NTCIP 1218 v01 format.
NTCIP_1218-1071
3.5.5.1.2 NTCIP 1218 v01 - Store WSA Configuration - Secure
Implemented with:
NTCIP_1218-1195 Generic Configure Table Row Dialog
Satisfied by:
NTCIP_1218-1722 WAVE Service Advertisement Service Table
NTCIP_1218-1725 WAVE Service Advertisement Index
NTCIP_1218-1726 WAVE Service Advertisement PSID
NTCIP_1218-1734 WAVE Service Advertisement Options
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-384 Backward Compatible with NTCIP 1218 v01
NTCIP_1218-1072

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall store the WSA header information in the NTCIP 1218 v01 format.
NTCIP_1218-1073
3.5.5.1.3 NTCIP 1218 v01 - Support SHA-1
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-384 Backward Compatible with NTCIP 1218 v01
NTCIP_1218-1074

The RSU shall support the use of SHA-1 hash function (SHA) used in HMAC-SHA-96.
NTCIP_1218-1075

Note: NIST has disallowed the use of SHA-1 for digital signature generation (as provided in NIST FIPS 186-4) except where specifically allowed by NIST protocol-specific guidance.
NTCIP_1218-1076
3.5.5.1.4 NTCIP 1218 v01 - Support SHA-2
Optionally fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-384 Backward Compatible with NTCIP 1218 v01
NTCIP_1218-1077

The RSU shall support the use of SHA-2 hash function (SHA) authentication protocol. The PRL in Table 6 specifies which authentication protocol to use.
NTCIP_1218-1078
3.5.5.1.5 NTCIP 1218 v01 - Support DTLS
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-384 Backward Compatible with NTCIP 1218 v01
NTCIP_1218-1079

The RSU shall support the use of the Datagram Transportation Layer Security (DTLS) Protocol as a transport model following RFC 6353.
NTCIP_1218-1080
3.5.5.1.6 NTCIP 1218 v01 – Support Configure Table Row
NTCIP_1218-1081

NTCIP 1218 v01 erroneously did not define a separate dialog for configuring a row in a dynamic table, particularly if the specified row did not exist. NTCIP 1218 v01A corrects this oversight by adding a new dialog, 4.2.8, Generic Configure Table Row Dialog – Dynamic Table. NTCIP 1218 v01A updates all requirements that configures a row in a dynamic table to point to the dialog 4.2.8 instead of dialog 4.2.3. In addition, NTCIP 1218 v01A adds support for a new object definition, rsuVerifyError, as part of dialog 4.2.8.
NTCIP_1218-1082

3.6 Supplemental Non-communications Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1083

Supplemental non-communications requirements for RSU follow. These requirements do not directly involve communications via the communications interfaces addressed by NTCIP 1218, but, if the supplemental requirement is selected in the PRL, the implementation shall fulfill the stated requirement to claim conformance to NTCIP 1218.
NTCIP_1218-1084

3.6.1 Security Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1085

Many of the security requirements (and design) for NTCIP 1218 make extensive use of the SNMPv3 security mechanisms available. This decision was made because SNMPv3 provides the most straightforward path for adoption at this time but other security mechanisms exist that may also be suitable and could be defined in future updates. For example, although NTCIP 1218 v01 specifies the use of USM and TSM below, this does not preclude the use of other security mechanisms as long as that mechanism does not conflict with the following requirements.
NTCIP_1218-1086

3.6.1.1 Authenticate Authorized Messages Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1087

The requirements for the RSU to authenticate and validate messages by signing with authorized certificates.
NTCIP_1218-1088
3.6.1.1.1 Support SHA-1 [Deprecated]
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

This requirement should be deleted as it no longer traces to anything
NTCIP_1218-1089

The RSU shall support the use of SHA-1 hash function (SHA) used in HMAC-SHA-96.
NTCIP_1218-1090

Note: NIST has disallowed the use of SHA-1 for digital signature generation (as provided in NIST FIPS 186-4) except where specifically allowed by NIST protocol-specific guidance.
NTCIP_1218-1091

Note: This requirement was deprecated in NTCIP 1218 v01A. See Annex D.1.3 for more information.
NTCIP_1218-1092
3.6.1.1.2 Support SHA-2 [Deprecated]
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Per the rules we have adopted, this should be deleted (i.e., it no longer traces and saying this while suggesting that CTI 4001 will support it is likely to result in confusion
NTCIP_1218-1093

The RSU shall support the use of SHA-2 hash function (SHA) authentication protocol. The PRL in Table 6 specifies which authentication protocol to use.
NTCIP_1218-1094

Note: This requirement was deprecated in NTCIP 1218 v01A. See Annex D.1.3 for more information.
NTCIP_1218-1095

3.6.1.2 Confidentiality Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1096

The requirements for the RSU to maintain the confidentiality of the data exchanged with the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-1097
3.6.1.2.1 Access RSU - USM
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-390 Manage Data Integrity
NTCIP_1218-394 Manage Confidentiality
NTCIP_1218-1098

The RSU shall support the use of the User-based Security Model (USM) for SNMPv3 in accordance with RFC 3414.
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Delete: This is redundant and less precise than ISO 15784-2. Specifically, ISO 15784-2 encourages limiting access via USM due to limitations in its security and high maintenance requirements
NTCIP_1218-1099
3.6.1.2.2 Access RSU - TSM
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-394 Manage Confidentiality
NTCIP_1218-1100

The RSU shall support the use of the Transport Security Model (TSM) for SNMPv3 in accordance with RFC 5591, implementing DTLS (RFC 6353) at a minimum.
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Delete: Redundant with ISO 15784-2
NTCIP_1218-1101
3.6.1.2.3 Support AES-256 Encryption
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-394 Manage Confidentiality
NTCIP_1218-1102

The RSU shall support the use of Advanced Encryption Standard 256-bit (AES-256) keys for encryption.
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

This is in conflict with ISO 15784-2 and is limited (i.e., it needs to specify the cipher suite to be supported). ISO 15784-2 requires TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, which is consistent with RFC 8446 and I believe is the current recommendation of CISA
NTCIP_1218-1103
3.6.1.2.4 Support DTLS [Deprecated]
NTCIP_1218-1104

The RSU shall support the use of the Datagram Transportation Layer Security (DTLS) Protocol as a transport model following RFC 6353.
NTCIP_1218-1105

Note: This requirement was deprecated in NTCIP 1218 v01A. See Annex D.1.4 for more information.
NTCIP_1218-1106

3.6.2 Response Time for Requests
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-274 Configure, Monitor, and Control the RSU
NTCIP_1218-276 Provide for Log Data Local Storage and R…
NTCIP_1218-1107

The RSU shall process all requests in accordance with all of the rules of the referenced standards (e.g., RFC 3416), including decrypting and uncompressing the request; processing certificates, updating the value in the database; and encrypting, compressing, and initiating the transmission of the appropriate response (assuming that the RSU has permission to transmit) within the Response Time. If the specification does not indicate the Response Time, the Response Time shall be less than 1,000 milliseconds. The Response Time is measured as the time between the receiving of the last byte of the request and the transmission of the first byte of the response.
NTCIP_1218-1108

This is a high-level requirement. The response time requirement for a specific request is defined by the requirement the request addresses and is implementation-specific, depending on how the implementation addresses security, for example.
NTCIP_1218-1109

Note: The original user need for this requirement for other NTCIP devices was based on systems using serial communications. For guidance, NTCIP 1103 v03 (Section 4.2.2.2) indicates the maximum response time shall be 100 milliseconds plus one millisecond for each byte in the response variable-bindings field. For testing purposes, the request consists of a single OID whose value is retrieved, e.g., rsuID.
NTCIP_1218-1110

3.6.3 Event Log Data Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1111

Supplemental requirements for logging events on the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-1112

3.6.3.1 Event Log - System Events
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-276 Provide for Log Data Local Storage and R…
NTCIP_1218-1113

When a system event occurs, the RSU shall write an entry in its event log containing system messages, including errors, information messages and warnings containing the following data:
NTCIP_1218-1114

Date and Time (in UTC) of the event.
NTCIP_1218-1477

A description of the system event that occurred.
NTCIP_1218-1115

For example, a startup of an application or when the RSU changes its operating mode should be logged as an event.
NTCIP_1218-1116

When an application event occurs, the RSU shall write an entry in its event log containing application messages, including errors, application configuration changes, information messages, and warnings containing the following data:
2024-11-12: Kenneth Vaughn

This is rather meaningless given the base support of a sysLog
NTCIP_1218-1478

Date and Time (in UTC) of the event.
NTCIP_1218-1118

A description of the system event that occurred.
NTCIP_1218-1119

For example, configuration of a detector zone should be logged as an event.
NTCIP_1218-1120

3.6.3.3 Event Log - RSU Configuration
2024-10-18: Kenneth Vaughn

This is a viable supplemental requirement to the syslog (i.e., it defines what the log shall contain). But it should be treated as such rather than being traced to the objects itself.
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-276 Provide for Log Data Local Storage and R…
NTCIP_1218-1121

When there is a change to the RSU configuration, the RSU shall write an entry in its event log containing the following data:
NTCIP_1218-1122

Date and Time (in UTC) of the event
NTCIP_1218-1479

The name and Object Identifier (OID) of the configuration parameter changed and the new value.
NTCIP_1218-1480

User ID and the network address of the user requesting the change.
NTCIP_1218-1123

NTCIP_1218-276 Provide for Log Data Local Storage and R…
NTCIP_1218-1124

When a notification is generated by the RSU (see Section 3.5.1.1.7), the RSU shall write an entry in its event log with the notification that is transmitted to a destination network address and port number. Each entry contains the following data:
NTCIP_1218-1481

Date and Time (in UTC) of the notification.
NTCIP_1218-1482

The notification message.
NTCIP_1218-1483

The notification alert level.
NTCIP_1218-1125

3.6.3.5 Event Log - Security
2024-10-18: Kenneth Vaughn

Retain as a supplemental requirement with traces to objects removed
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-276 Provide for Log Data Local Storage and R…
NTCIP_1218-1126

When an event occurs that may pose a potential security risk, such as an authentication failure, data integrity failure, availability failures (for authorized/unauthorized users), and confidentiality failures, the RSU shall write an entry in its event log. Each entry contains the following data:
NTCIP_1218-1484

Date and Time of the event.
NTCIP_1218-1485

Description of the potential risk.
NTCIP_1218-1486

User ID of the user (if applicable).
NTCIP_1218-1487

Network address and port of the source.
NTCIP_1218-1127

3.6.3.6 Event Log - Stored Message
2024-10-18: Kenneth Vaughn

Retain as a supplemental requirement with traces to objects removed
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-276 Provide for Log Data Local Storage and R…
NTCIP_1218-1128

When an event to change a stored message on the RSU occurs, the RSU shall write an entry in its event log. The log entry contains the following data:
NTCIP_1218-1488

Date and Time (in UTC) of the event.
NTCIP_1218-1489

The message, as stored on the RSU and identified by its index.
NTCIP_1218-1490

Classification of the operation (installation, removal, or modification).
NTCIP_1218-1491

User ID of the user performing the operation.
NTCIP_1218-1129

3.6.3.7 Event Log - Immediate Forward Message
2024-10-18: Kenneth Vaughn

Retain as a supplemental requirement with traces to objects removed
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-276 Provide for Log Data Local Storage and R…
NTCIP_1218-1130

When an event changing a message received for forwarding to the V2X interface occurs, the RSU shall write an entry in its event log. The intent is to log only when the table containing the IFM messages is changed, not when the contents of the message changes. The log entry contains the following data:
NTCIP_1218-1492

Date and Time (in UTC) of the event.
NTCIP_1218-1493

The message received for forwarding to the V2X interface.
NTCIP_1218-1494

Classification of the operation (installation, removal, or modification).
NTCIP_1218-1495

User ID of the user performing the operation.
NTCIP_1218-1131

3.6.4 Interface Data Log Data Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1132

Requirements for the interface data logging services on the RSU follow.
NTCIP_1218-1133

3.6.4.1 Interface Data Log Format
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-1134
3.6.4.1.1 PCAP Format

Upon request from a management station, the RSU shall log interface data packets across a specified interface in the packet capture (pcap) format.
NTCIP_1218-1999
3.6.4.1.2 Libpcap for Linux

Unix-based systems shall use libpcap for logging interface data packets.
2024-10-18: Kenneth Vaughn

Revised text to make the reference normative. NOTE: Do we want to reference 1.9.0 or 1.1.1 (v01A1 referenced 1.9.0 in the norm ref but 1.1.1 in the text)
NTCIP_1218-2000
3.6.4.1.3 WinPcap for Windows

Microsoft Windows-based systems shall use WinPcap for logging interface data packets.
2024-10-18: Kenneth Vaughn

Revised text to make the reference normative.
NTCIP_1218-1135

3.6.4.2 Interface Data Log File Format
Fulfills:
NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-1136

Upon request from a management station, the interface data log file for the RSU shall contain the following data:
NTCIP_1218-1496

Date and Time, with minimum deci-seconds resolution, when the packet was logged, in UTC.
NTCIP_1218-1497

Received Signal Strength Indication (RSSI) for packets received over the V2X interface (in units of dbm).
NTCIP_1218-1498

Transmit Power for packets transmitted over the V2X interface (in units of dBm).
NTCIP_1218-1499

Complete packet transmitted or received (including headers and footers).
NTCIP_1218-1137

3.6.4.3 Interface Data Log File Naming Convention Requirements
NTCIP_1218-1138

The requirements for the naming convention of an interface data log file for a RSU follows.
NTCIP_1218-1139
3.6.4.3.1 Support RSU Identifier in the Interface Data Log Filename
2024-10-18: Kenneth Vaughn

No need for object reference as this is not a dialog.

NTCIP_1218-1682 Interface Log Name

NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data

The RSU shall log interface data packets in a file using a filename consisting of the identifier of the RSU. This is the <identifier> field as defined in Section 5.8.2.8, rsuIfaceLogName.

NTCIP_1218-1143

NTCIP_1218-1144

NTCIP_1218-315 Manage Logging of Interface Data
NTCIP_1218-1146
