5.9.10.2 Application Certificate PSID

<Definition> Contains the PSIDs associated with this application certificate (up to 63). The PSID is formatted per IEEE1609.12 Table 2 as P-encoded values. All PSIDs are to be padded to a 4-octet length. The current PSID assignments can be found at https://standards.ieee.org/products-services/regauth/psid/public/.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.8.10.1.2
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-807 Report IEEE 1609.2 Application Certifica…
NTCIP_1218-813 Store IEEE 1609.2 Application Certificat…
NTCIP_1218-1063 Report Expiration Date - Application Cer…
NTCIP_1218-1702

5.9.10.3 Application Certificate State

<Definition> Provides the status of the application certificates for the RSU. Validity check is based on geographic region and time. notValid(3) includes expired or if no valid certificates are available. future(4) indicates certificates not valid until a future date - for example validInFuture for BSMs. expirationPending(5) indicates that the certificates expire within than the value of the rsuSecAppCertExpirationPending object.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.8.10.1.3
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-807 Report IEEE 1609.2 Application Certifica…
NTCIP_1218-1703

5.9.10.4 Application Certificate Expiration

<Definition> Provides the number of hours remaining before the existing application certificate expires.
<Valid Value Rule> A value of 0 indicates the certificates expire that day, but have not expired yet. A value of 255 indicates the certificates have expired. A value of 254 indicates the expiration date is 254 hours or longer.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.8.10.1.4
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-807 Report IEEE 1609.2 Application Certifica…
NTCIP_1218-1063 Report Expiration Date - Application Cer…
NTCIP_1218-1704

<Definition> Provides configuration parameters for when an RSU should request new 1609.2 security credentials in hours before the application certificate expire.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.8.10.1.5

<Definition> Provides the Fully Qualified Domain Resource (FQDN) locator (URL) from which to request updated certificate revocation lists. The URL shall include the protocol to be used, e.g., https://.

5.9.17 RSU Application Certificate Expiration Pending Period

<Definition> Defines the number of days before the application certificates expire within which rsuSecAppCertState indicates a status of expirationPending. For example, if the value of rsuSecAppCertExpirationPending is 6, valid application certificates that expire in less than 6 days will indicate a rsuSecAppCertState of expirationPending(5). Valid application certificates that expire in more than 6 days will indicate a resSecAppCertState of valid(2).
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.8.17
Satisfies:

NTCIP_1218-1732

5.10.2.8 WAVE Service Advertisement Status

<Definition> RowStatus as defined by RFC2579 with minimum support for active(1), notInService(2), notReady(3), createAndGo(4) and destroy(6).

Prior to creating a new row, a management station should be aware of all rows already in use.

This object shall have a status of 'notReady' unless valid values exist for all objects contained in the corresponding row.

When this object has a value of 'active', an implementation shall allow modifying the values of rsuWsaEnable and this object for the corresponding row and should reject any request to modify any other object in the corresponding row.

An implementation should reject any request to change this object to 'notInService (2)' while rsuWsaEnable = 'enabled (1)'.

See Requirement 3.6.9 and 3.6.10 in the PRL for performance requirements.

<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.2.1.8
2024-11-13: Kenneth Vaughn

Revised text to conform to RFC 2579 recommendations.
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-831 Store WSA Configuration - Service Info S…
NTCIP_1218-853 Store WSA Configuration – RCPI Threshold
NTCIP_1218-1733

5.10.2.9 WAVE Service Advertisement MAC Address

<Definition> MAC address of the server associated with the requested service.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.2.1.9
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-831 Store WSA Configuration - Service Info S…
NTCIP_1218-1734

5.10.2.10 WAVE Service Advertisement Options

<Definition> A bit-mapped value as defined below for configuring the transmitted WSA.
BIT 0 0=unsecuredWsa, 1=securedWsa --deprecated in amendment 1A. SET to 0.
BIT 1 WRA 0=not transmitted, 1=transmitted --deprecated in amendment 1A. SET to 0.
BIT 2 Repeat Rate 0=not transmitted, 1=transmitted --deprecated in amendment 1A. SET to 0.
BIT 3 2DLocation 0=not transmitted, 1=transmitted --deprecated in amendment 1A. SET to 0.
BIT 4 3DLocation 0=not transmitted, 1=transmitted --deprecated in amendment 1A. SET to 0.
BIT 5 RcpiThreshold 0=not transmitted, 1=transmitted
BIT 6 Reserved
BIT 7 Reserved

Bit 0 - Indicates if security processing to be applied to the transmitted WSA.
Bit 1 - Indicates if the WSA should include the WAVE Routing Advertisement. --deprecated
Bit 2 - Indicates if the Repeat Rate is transmitted in the WSA Header. --deprecated
Bit 3 - Indicates if the 2DLocation is transmitted in the WSA Header. The 2DLocation value is defined by rsuLocationLat and rsuLocationLong. If Bit 4=1, then the 3DLocation value is transmitted and 2DLocation is not. --deprecated
Bit 4 - Indicates if the 3DLocation is transmitted in the WSA Header. The 2DLocation value is defined by rsuLocationLat, rsuLocationLong and rsuLocationElv. --deprecated
Bit 5 - Indicates if the RcpiThreshold value is transmitted in the WSA Header.
See Section 2.5 of RFC 3416 for encoding.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.2.1.10
Satisfies:
Notes-19 Store WSA Configuration – RCPI Threshold
NTCIP_1218-837 Store WSA Configuration – Secure [Deprec…
NTCIP_1218-1071 NTCIP 1218 v01 - Store WSA Configuration…
Satisfies with note:
NTCIP_1218-853 Store WSA Configuration – RCPI Threshold
NTCIP_1218-1735

5.10.2.11 WAVE Service Advertisement RCPI Threshold

<Definition> The RCPI value to be transmitted with the WSA. Per IEEE 1609.3, this is the recommended minimum received WSA signal value in dBm, 0 to -110, below which the service should be ignored by a recipient. Coded per IEEE Std 802.11/18.3.10. NOTE-UPER does not include rules that can encode ranged values which include negative numbers. i.e., all values in a range are encoded as unsigned. The base of the range is encoded as 0, and all other values in the range are encoded as offsets to 0.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.2.1.11
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-831 Store WSA Configuration - Service Info S…
NTCIP_1218-1736

5.10.2.12 WAVE Service Advertisement Count Threshold

<Definition> The WSA Count Threshold value to be transmitted with the WSA. Per IEEE 1609.3, this is the recommended minimum number of received WSAs, below which a service should be ignored by a recipient.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.2.1.12
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-831 Store WSA Configuration - Service Info S…
NTCIP_1218-1737

5.10.2.13 WAVE Service Advertisement Count Interval

<Definition> The WSA Count Threshold Interval. Per IEEE 1609.3, this is the time interval over which received WSAs are counted.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.2.1.13
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-831 Store WSA Configuration - Service Info S…
NTCIP_1218-1738

Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-831 Store WSA Configuration - Service Info S…
NTCIP_1218-1739

5.10.2.15 WAVE Service Advertiser Identifier

<Definition> A string identifying the service provider device that may be included in the WSA header. A string of SIZE (0) indicates to ignore this element and is not transmitted in the IEEE 1609.3 WSA header.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.2.1.15
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-831 Store WSA Configuration - Service Info S…
NTCIP_1218-1740

5.10.2.16 WAVE Service Advertisement Enable

<Definition> This object when set to TRUE (1) shall cause the Roadside Unit to perform a consistency check to confirm that the values in this row and the associated row in the rsuWsaChannelTable (See 5.10.4), as determined by the PSID (see rsuWsaChannelPsid), are valid. If the consistency check fails, the value of this object shall automatically return to FALSE (0), a genError is returned, and an error is logged.

A value of 1 indicates that this WSA entry is enabled and should be broadcasted over the V2X Interface.
A value of 0 indicates that this WSA entry is disabled and should not be broadcasted.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.2.1.16
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-831 Store WSA Configuration - Service Info S…
NTCIP_1218-1741

<Definition> Represents the channel number that the service is to be advertised on. For DSRC radios in the United States, the channel is from 180 to 184, as defined by IEEE 802.11. For PC5 radios in the United States, the channel number is found in Table 7 of NTCIP 1218 v01.

5.10.3.4 WAVE Service Advertisement Transmit Power Level

<Definition> Represents the transmission power, in dBm, for the transmission of the service advertisement on the associated channel. Note that the Effective Isotropic Radiated Power (EIRP) is the sum of this object and the antenna gain (rsuAntGain).
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.3.1.4

5.10.3.6 WAVE Service Advertisement Channel Status

<Definition> RowStatus as defined by RFC2579 with minimum support for active(1), notInService(2), notReady(3), createAndGo(4) and destroy(6).

Prior to creating a new row, a management station should be aware of all rows already in use.

This object shall have a status of 'notReady' unless valid values exist for all objects contained in the corresponding row.

When this object has a value of 'active', an implementation shall allow modifying the values of this object for the corresponding row and should reject any request to modify any other object in the corresponding row.

See Requirement 3.6.9 and 3.6.10 in the PRL for performance requirements.

<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.3.1.6

NTCIP_1218-1750

5.10.4 WAVE Service Advertisement Version

<Definition> WSA version as identified by IEEE 1609.3. The value is 3 for a WSA message conformant with IEEE 1609.3.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.4
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-840 Report WSA Version Number
NTCIP_1218-1751

5.10.5 WAVE Service Advertisement Header Options

<Definition> A bit-mapped value as defined below for configuring the transmitted WSA headers.
BIT 0 0=unsecuredWsa, 1=securedWsa
BIT 1 WRA 0=not transmitted, 1=transmitted
BIT 2 Repeat Rate 0=not transmitted, 1=transmitted
BIT 3 2DLocation 0=not transmitted, 1=transmitted
BIT 4 3DLocation 0=not transmitted, 1=transmitted
BIT 5 Reserved
BIT 6 Reserved
BIT 7 Reserved

Bit 0 - Indicates if security processing to be applied to the transmitted WSA. This should normally be 1=securedWsa.
Bit 1 - Indicates if the WSA should include the WAVE Routing Advertisement.
Bit 2 - Indicates if the Repeat Rate is transmitted in the WSA Header.
Bit 3 - Indicates if the 2DLocation is transmitted in the WSA Header. The 2DLocation value is defined by rsuLocationLat and rsuLocationLong. If Bit 4=1, then the 3DLocation value is transmitted and 2DLocation is not.
Bit 4 - Indicates if the 3DLocation is transmitted in the WSA Header. The 2DLocation value is defined by rsuLocationLat, rsuLocationLong and rsuLocationElv.
See Section 2.5 of RFC 3416 for encoding.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.5
Satisfies:
Notes-14 Store WSA Configuration – Secure V2
Notes-15 Store WSA Configuration – WAVE Routing A…
Notes-16 Store WSA Configuration – Repeat Rate
Notes-17 Store WSA Configuration – 2D Location
Notes-18 Store WSA Configuration – 3D Location
NTCIP_1218-1752

<Definition> The P-Max is used to limit the User Equipment's uplink conducted transmission power on a carrier frequency and is used to calculate the parameter Pcompensation defined in TS 36.304. <UNITS: dBm>
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.2

<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.3

NTCIP_1218-1756

5.10.6.4 WSA LTE-V2X Sidelink Transmission Pool

<Definition> This field identifies an individual pool entry configured for sidelink transmission, used for communication and discovery. 4 is the maximum number of individual sidelink Transmit resource pools.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.4
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-855 Report WSA Configuration – Extended Chan…
NTCIP_1218-1757

5.10.6.5 WSA LTE-V2X Minimum MCS

<Definition> This field indicates the minimum MCS value used for transmissions on PSSCH (see TS 36.213). minMCS-PSSCH-r14 corresponds to the MCS table in Table 8.6.1-1 in TS 36.213 with 64QAM indices overridden by 16QAM used for transmission on PSSCH.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.5
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-855 Report WSA Configuration – Extended Chan…
NTCIP_1218-1758

5.10.6.6 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum MCS

<Definition> > This field indicates the maximum MCS value used for transmissions on PSSCH (see TS 36.213). maxMCS-PSSCH-r14 corresponds to the MCS table in Table 8.6.1-1 in TS 36.213 with 64QAM indices overridden by 16QAM used for transmission on PSSCH.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.6
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-855 Report WSA Configuration – Extended Chan…
NTCIP_1218-1759

5.10.6.7 WSA LTE-V2X Minimum Packet Delay Budget

<Definition> This field indicates the lowest packet delay budget (PDB) that a user device connecting to the service on the indicated channel shall use. A user device may use a higher PDB value. PDB is defined as the maximum delay (in milliseconds) that a packet can tolerate before transmission once it is received by the modem from an application stack.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.7
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-855 Report WSA Configuration – Extended Chan…
NTCIP_1218-1760

5.10.6.8 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum Transmission Unit Size

<Definition> This field indicates the maximum transmission unit size in octets.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.8
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-855 Report WSA Configuration – Extended Chan…
NTCIP_1218-1761

5.10.6.9 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum Bandwidth Per Second

<Definition> This field indicates the maximum bandwidth per second available on a channel. See rsuWsaLteMaxBwPerSecUnit for the units to be used with this value.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.9
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-855 Report WSA Configuration – Extended Chan…
NTCIP_1218-1762

5.10.6.10 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum Bandwidth Per Second Units

<Definition> This field indicates the units for the value defined in rsuWsaLteMaxBwPerSec. A value of megabytes(4) indicates megabytes per second.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.10
Satisfies:

NTCIP_1218-1763

5.10.6.11 WSA LTE-V2X Minimum Periodicity

<Definition> This field indicates the minimum traffic periodicity. It has the same semantics as the field trafficPeriodicity-r14 as specified in TS 36.331.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.11
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-855 Report WSA Configuration – Extended Chan…
NTCIP_1218-1764

5.10.6.12 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum Speed

<Definition> This field indicates the speed in units of kilometers per hour such that users should not participate in the service opportunity if they are traveling at greater than that speed.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.12
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-855 Report WSA Configuration – Extended Chan…
NTCIP_1218-1765

5.10.6.13 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum Range

<Definition> This field indicates the distance in units of meters such that users should not participate in the service opportunity if they are farther away from the Provider than that distance. This field shall not be included unless one of the WSA Header Extension fields 2DLocation or 3DLocation is present in the WSA.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.13
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-855 Report WSA Configuration – Extended Chan…
NTCIP_1218-1766

5.10.6.14 WSA LTE-V2X Maximum Channel Busy Ratio

<Definition> This field indicates the maximum channel busy ratio (CBR) expressed in units of single percentage points, such that users should not participate in the service opportunity if the CBR is greater than the indicated value.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.9.6.14
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-855 Report WSA Configuration – Extended Chan…
NTCIP_1218-1767

5.11 WAVE Router Advertisement Configuration

<Definition> A node containing information about the WAVE router advertisement of the RSU.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.10
NTCIP_1218-1768

5.11.1 WAVE Router Advertisement Prefix

<Definition> IPv6 address prefix of WRA Service Advertised. For IPv6 remote destination, this address can be represented as zero-compressed simplified IPv6 address, for example 2031:0:130F::9C0:876A:130B.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.10.1

5.11.2 WAVE Router Advertisement Prefix Length

<Definition> Length of IPv6 address prefix of WRA Service Advertised. A 64-bit prefix is '0x40', a 60-bit prefix is '0x3c' and a 52-bit prefix is '0x34'.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.10.2
Satisfies:

NTCIP_1218-1783

5.12.2.4 RSU Message Counter Direction

<Definition> Represents the direction of messages exchanged over the V2X Interface to be recorded. Inbound indicates only messages transmitted by the RSU over the V2X Interface is to be counted, while outbound indicates only messages received by the RSU over the V2X Interface is counted.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.11.2.1.4
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-922 Report Number of Messages Exchanged
NTCIP_1218-962 Report Number of Messages Exchanged by V…
NTCIP_1218-1784

5.12.2.5 RSU Message Start Time

<Definition> Contains the time the message counter began for this row. If this object is SET by a user, this is the start time to begin the message count. Otherwise, the system uses the time the RSU was last rebooted. DateAndTime is of length 8 octets.

If a user attempts to SET this object to time that has already passed, the value of this object shall be equal to the date the current time (that this object was SET). For example, if a user attempts to SET this object to January 1 2023 12:00:00.0 (07 D6 01 01 0C 00 00 00), but the current time is February 1 2023 00:00:00.0 (07 D6 02 01 00 00 00 00), then this object will be SET to 07 D6 02 01 00 00 00 00.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.11.2.1.5
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-922 Report Number of Messages Exchanged
NTCIP_1218-962 Report Number of Messages Exchanged by V…
NTCIP_1218-1785

5.12.2.6 RSU Message Counter

<Definition> Contains the number of messages that have exchanged since the time defined by rsuMessageCountsByPsidTime. This value assumes that the rsuMessageCountsByPsidRowStatus for this row has remained active since rsuMessageCountsByPsidTime. Note that this counter does not initialize to zero at startup.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.11.2.1.6
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-922 Report Number of Messages Exchanged
NTCIP_1218-962 Report Number of Messages Exchanged by V…
NTCIP_1218-1786

5.12.2.7 RSU Message Counter Status

<Definition> RowStatus as defined by RFC2579 with minimum support for active(1), notInService(2), notReady(3), createAndGo(4) and destroy(6).

Prior to creating a new row, a management station should be aware of all rows already in use.

This object shall have a status of 'notReady' unless valid values exist for all objects contained in the corresponding row.

When this object has a value of 'active', an implementation shall allow modifying the values of rsuMessageCountsByPsidTime and this object for the corresponding row and should reject any request to modify any other object in the corresponding row.

See Requirement 3.6.9 and 3.6.10 in the PRL for performance requirements.

<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.11.2.1.7
2024-11-13: Kenneth Vaughn

Revised text to conform to RFC 2579 recommendations.

2024-11-13: Kenneth Vaughn

Is there any situation where we do not want to allow disabling (e.g., when in use)?
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-922 Report Number of Messages Exchanged
NTCIP_1218-1787

<Definition> The geographic sector surrounding the RSU that the statistics for this row is for. The geographic area surrounding the RSU is divided into sixteen 22.5 degrees sectors. Sector 1 starts from North and ends at 22.5 degrees from North in an eastward direction.

5.13.6.4 RSU Communications Range - Filter Type

<Definition> Provides additional filters for the SAE J2735 messages, such as vehicle type or vehicle class. No filter indicates any SAE J2735 message as identified by rsuCommRangeMsgId. vehicleType indicates filter by DE_VehicleType as defined in SAE J2735. vehicleClass indicates filter by DE_BasicVehicleClass as defined in SAE J2735. The value to filter by is defined by rsuCommRangeFilterValue.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.12.6.1.4
Satisfies:

NTCIP_1218-982 Manage RF Communications Range Statistic…
NTCIP_1218-1800

5.13.6.5 RSU Communications Range - Filter Value

<Definition> The value to filter statistics by, based on the filter type defined by rsuCommRangeFilterType. This filter is in addition to the SAE J2735 message type, as defined by rsuCommRangeMsgId.
For example, if the value of rsuCommRangeFilterType is vehicleType, a value of 4 indicates filter by vehicleType with a value of 4 (passenger car).
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.12.6.1.5
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-970 Report the RF Communications Distance - …
NTCIP_1218-972 Report the RF Communications Distance - …

NTCIP_1218-978 Report the Average RF Communications Dis…
NTCIP_1218-980 Report the Average RF Communications Dis…
NTCIP_1218-982 Manage RF Communications Range Statistic…
NTCIP_1218-1801

5.13.6.6 RSU Communications Range - 1 Minute

<Definition> The farthest distance, in meters, from the RSU that a message was received via the V2X radio over the previous 1-minute period.
<Valid Value Rule> A value of 0 indicates no messages have been received. Values from 1 to 1999 represents 1 meter to 1999 meters. A value of 2000 indicates a distance of 2000 meters or greater. A value of 2001 indicates unknown.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.12.6.1.6
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-970 Report the RF Communications Distance - …
NTCIP_1218-1802

<Definition> The farthest distance, in meters, from the RSU that a message was received via the V2X radio over the previous 5-minute period.
<Valid Value Rule> A value of 0 indicates no messages have been received. Values from 1 to 1999 represents 1 meter to 1999 meters. A value of 2000 indicates a distance of 2000 meters or greater. A value of 2001 indicates unknown.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.12.6.1.7

5.13.6.12 RSU Communications Range Status

<Definition> RowStatus as defined by RFC2579 with minimum support for active(1), notInService(2), notReady(3), createAndGo(4) and destroy(6).

Prior to creating a new row, a management station should be aware of all rows already in use.

This object shall have a status of 'notReady' unless valid values exist for all objects contained in the corresponding row.

When this object has a value of 'active', an implementation shall allow modifying the values of this object for the corresponding row and should reject any request to modify any other object in the corresponding row.

See Requirement 3.6.9 and 3.6.10 in the PRL for performance requirements.

<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.12.6.1.12

NTCIP_1218-1808

5.14 System Description

<Definition> A node containing information about the RSU.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13
NTCIP_1218-1809

5.14.1 RSU MIB Version

<Definition> Contains the version of this MIB supported by this RSU, e.g. rsuMIB 4.1 rev201812060000Z.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.1
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

supersede with sysORID. per ISO 26048-1 (i.e., RFC 3418)
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-526 Report RSU MIB Version
NTCIP_1218-1810

5.14.2 RSU Firmware Version

<Definition> Contains the version of firmware running on this RSU.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.2
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Replace with ISO 26048-1 specified RFC 6933 entPhysicalFirmwareRev, etc

NTCIP_1218-569 Update the RSU Firmware Version

NTCIP_1218-886 Install a Configuration File
NTCIP_1218-1811

5.14.3 RSU Location Description

<Definition> Contains a description of the installation location of this RSU.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.3

2024-11-13: Kenneth Vaughn

Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-534 Store RSU Location Description
NTCIP_1218-1812

5.14.4 RSU Identifier

<Definition> Contains the ID given to this RSU.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.4
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Is this really different than sysName: DisplayString (SIZE(0..255)); 

An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-518 Store RSU Identifier
NTCIP_1218-1813

5.14.5 RSU Reference Location - Latitude

<Definition> Contains the reference latitude of the RSU, in 10^-7 degrees, using the WGS-84 (World Geodetic System 1984). The value 900000001 represents unknown. This value can be used to calculate the 2DLocation or 3DLocation field in the IEEE 1609.3 WSA header.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.5
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Consider replacing with fdCabinetLatitude
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-536 Store RSU Location
NTCIP_1218-1814

5.14.6 RSU Reference Location - Longitude

<Definition> Contains the reference longitude of the RSU, in 10^-7 degrees using the WGS-84 (World Geodetic System 1984). The value 1800000001 represents unknown. This value can be used to calculate the 2DLocation or 3DLocation field in the IEEE 1609.3 WSA header.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.6
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Consider replacing with fdCabinetLongitude
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-536 Store RSU Location
NTCIP_1218-1815

5.14.7 RSU Reference Location - Elevation

<Definition> Contains the reference elevation of the RSU, as measured to the base of the GNSS antenna, in centimeters above the reference ellipsoid as defined by the WGS-84. The value of 1000001 represents unknown. This value can be used to calculate the 3DLocation field in the IEEE 1609.3 WSA header.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.7
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Consider replacing with fdCabinetElevation
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-536 Store RSU Location
NTCIP_1218-1816

5.14.8 RSU Reference Location - Elevation Offset

<Definition> The offset in height, in centimeters, from the antenna of a GNSS or similar geopositioning device to the base of the structure that the RSU is mounted on. It is assumed that the antenna is at a height higher than the base of the structure.
<Valid Value Rule> Values of 0 to 2000 provides a range from 0 centimeters to 2000 centimeters. The value of 2001 represents unknown.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.8
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-539 Store RSU Location - GNSS Antenna Offset
NTCIP_1218-1817

5.14.9 RSU Installation Command

<Definition> This object when set to TRUE (one) shall cause the Roadside Unit to begin processing the installation file (rsuInstallFile) on the RSU at the scheduled time (See rsuScheduledInstallTime). This object shall automatically return to FALSE (zero) after the Roadside Unit has issued the update reset command. At the successful completion of the installation process, the value of the rsuFirmwareVersion object or row in the globalModuleTable is also updated.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.9
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-569 Update the RSU Firmware Version
NTCIP_1218-879 Install an RSU Application
NTCIP_1218-886 Install a Configuration File
NTCIP_1218-1818

5.14.10 RSU Installation Filename

<Definition> Represents the name of the installation files for the Roadside Unit to process. A SET of the rsuInstallUpdate object starts the process to install the referenced file.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.10
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Changed to SnmpAdminString. Deleted redundant size constraint.
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-569 Update the RSU Firmware Version
NTCIP_1218-879 Install an RSU Application
NTCIP_1218-886 Install a Configuration File
NTCIP_1218-1819

5.14.11 RSU Installation Path

<Definition> Indicates the path where the file to be installed (rsuInstallFile) can be found. If the subdirectory is relative to the root directory, start with the string '/'. For example, if the value of this object is '/install', the (rsuInstallFile) would be found under the install subdirectory of the root directory.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.11
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Changed to SnmpAdminString. 
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-569 Update the RSU Firmware Version
NTCIP_1218-879 Install an RSU Application
NTCIP_1218-886 Install a Configuration File
NTCIP_1218-1820

5.14.12 RSU Installation Status

<Definition> Provides the status of the installation process for the RSU. An attempt to update the software may be rejected for a security reason, such as it has not been authenticated. If applicable, if an attempt to update the software fails, the software should be roll-backed to the pre-update version.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.12
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-569 Update the RSU Firmware Version
NTCIP_1218-571 Report Firmware Update Status
NTCIP_1218-879 Install an RSU Application
NTCIP_1218-882 Report Software Update Status
NTCIP_1218-886 Install a Configuration File
NTCIP_1218-888 Report Configuration File Update Status
NTCIP_1218-1821

5.14.13 RSU Installation Status Time

<Definition> Contains the date and time the rsuInstallStatus object was last updated. DateAndTime of length 8 octets.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.13
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-571 Report Firmware Update Status
NTCIP_1218-882 Report Software Update Status
NTCIP_1218-888 Report Configuration File Update Status
NTCIP_1218-1822

5.14.14 RSU Installation Status Message

<Definition> This object conveys a detailed status or error message about the status of an installation process. If an attempt to update the software fails, this message provides the reason for the failure.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.14
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Changed to SnmpAdminString. Deleted redundant size constraint
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-571 Report Firmware Update Status
NTCIP_1218-882 Report Software Update Status
NTCIP_1218-888 Report Configuration File Update Status
NTCIP_1218-1823

5.14.15 RSU Scheduled Installation Time

<Definition> This object indicates the date and time the Roadside Unit is to begin processing the installation file (rsuInstallFile) on the RSU. If the value is 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00, then the Roadside Unit shall begin processing the installation file as soon as possible. This object shall automatically return to 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 after the Roadside Unit begins processing the installation file.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.13.15
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-882 Report Software Update Status
NTCIP_1218-1824

5.15 System Settings

<Definition> A node containing information about the RSU configuration for notifications and logs.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14
NTCIP_1218-1825

5.15.1 Notification Destination Address

<Definition> Contains the IP address of the SNMP Manager that receives the SNMP Notifications (SNMP traps). For an IPv4 remote destination, this address can be represented as an IPv4 quad-dotted IP address, for example, 192.33.44.235. For IPv6 remote destination, this address can be represented as zero-compressed simplified IPv6 address, for example 2031:0:130F::9C0:876A:130B.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.1
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with RFC 3413 snmpTargetAddrTDomain and snmpTargetAddrTAddress
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-591 Store Notification Destination Address
NTCIP_1218-1826

5.15.2 Notification Destination Port

<Definition> Contains the port number of the SNMP Manager that receives the SNMP Notifications (SNMP traps). Default is 162.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.2
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with RFC 3413 snmpTargetAddrTAddress
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-593 Store Notification Destination Port
NTCIP_1218-1827

5.15.3 System Log Query Start Time

<Definition> Start time, in UTC, for filtering events. This time is supplied in the format of the first 8 octets in the DateAndTime field as defined in RFC2579. Example: October 7, 2017 at 11:34:01.4 PM UTC would be encoded as 07e10a0717220104.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.3
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with ISO 26048-1 fdSyslogQueryStart
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-506 Retrieve Event Logged Data
NTCIP_1218-1828

5.15.4 System Log Query Stop Time

<Definition> Stop time, in UTC, for filtering events. This time is supplied in the format of the first 8 octets in the DateAndTime field as defined in RFC2579. Example: October 7, 2017 at 11:34:01.4 PM UTC would be encoded as 07e10a0717220104.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.4
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with ISO 26048-1 fdSyslogQueryStop
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-506 Retrieve Event Logged Data
NTCIP_1218-1829

5.15.5 System Log Query Priority

<Definition> A value for filtering events based on the priority (severity) level as defined in Table 2 of RFC 5424. The filter is for events with the priority level indicated.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.5
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with ISO 26048-1 fdSyslogQuerySeverity
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-506 Retrieve Event Logged Data
NTCIP_1218-1830

5.15.6 System Log Query Generate

<Definition> This object when set to TRUE (one) shall cause the RSU to start the creation of a log file for upload using the defined filters (e.g., rsuSysLogQueryStart, rsuSysLogQueryStop). This object shall automatically return to FALSE (zero) after the RSU has issued the start query command and when the log file is available for retrieval. The RSU shall also provide the name of the file to be retrieved in the rsuSysLogName object.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.6
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with ISO 26048-1 fdSyslogQueryGenerate
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-506 Retrieve Event Logged Data
NTCIP_1218-1831

5.15.7 System Log Query Status

<Definition> The status of an event log query process.
unknown: The status of unknown or no event log query process in progress.
other: The status of the event log query process is not defined by NTCIP 1218.
processing: The event log query process is active.
successful: The event log query process has properly completed.
outOfRange - The query start or stop time is invalid.
badFilename - The query filename is invalid.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.7
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with ISO 26048-1 fdSyslogQueryStatus
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-506 Retrieve Event Logged Data
NTCIP_1218-1832

5.15.8 System Log Close Command

<Definition> This object when set to TRUE (one) shall cause the RSU to command the syslog file to close at the earliest convenient time. This object shall automatically return to FALSE (zero) after the RSU has issued the close command and when the log file is available for retrieval. The RSU shall also provide the name of the file to be retrieved in the rsuSysLogName object.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.8
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-503 Close an Active Event Log File
NTCIP_1218-1833

5.15.9 System Log Severity

<Definition> This object defines the greatest enumerated severity level of events that are to be recorded in the RSU's syslog. For example, a value of error indicates that error conditions are to be logged, in addition to critical, alert, and emergency messages. The values are defined in RFC 5424 Table 2.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.9
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with ISO 26048-1 fdSyslogSeverity
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-501 Configure Priority Level for Events
NTCIP_1218-1834

5.15.10 System Configuration File

<Definition> Contains the name of the system configuration to use as part of the RSU's startup functions. The system configuration is vendor-specific, but the vendor shall provide and document the distinct identifiers that amounts to the system configuration parameters.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.10
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Do we really need to keep the 128 char limit rather than the default 255?

2024-11-13: Kenneth Vaughn

Changed to SnmpAdminString. 
Satisfies with note:
NTCIP_1218-559 Manage RSU Startup Functions - Configura…
NTCIP_1218-1835

5.15.11 System Startup Retries

<Definition> This object defines the allowable number of attempts within the time defined by the rsuSysRetryPeriod to properly reboot an RSU before the RSU enters the 'fault' operating mode. An RSU fails to properly reboot if the firmware, operating system, or drivers do not load properly during its startup routine as a result of a power up or a reboot. A value of 0 indicates this feature is disabled (the RSU cannot enter the 'fault' operating mode).
For example, if the value of this object is 4, the RSU enters the 'fault' operating mode during a fifth reboot within the rsuSysRetryPeriod.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.11
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with ISO 26048-1 fdControllerStartupRetries
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-561 Configure Startup Retries
NTCIP_1218-1836

5.15.12 System Startup Retry Period

<Definition> This object defines the period of time, in minutes, during which a user-defined number of startups (See rsuSysRetries) are allowed before the RSU enters the 'fault' mode operating mode. An RSU fails to properly reboot if the firmware, operating system, or drivers do not load properly during its startup routine as a result of a power up or a reboot. A value of 0 indicates this feature is disabled (the RSU cannot enter the 'fault' operating mode).
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.12
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with ISO 26048-1 fdControllerStartupMaxDuration

2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Both this and ISO 26048-1 have the same issue; the manufacturer defines max duration and the user defines how many retries. Is that really the intent? Or should the manufacturer define how long each reboot is supposed to take before starting again?
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-563 Retrieve Startup Retry Period
NTCIP_1218-1837

5.15.13 Short Communications Loss Time

<Definition> Defines the time, in seconds, since the last valid communications message with the management station to the threshold where it is considered a short-term communications loss event. A value of 0 disables this function. A communications loss is when the RSU has not received a valid communications message from the management station. A management station may intermittently transmit a GET request for any object, such as an object in the rsuMsgRepeatStatusTable, to avoid a communication loss event.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.13
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-575 Configure Short-Term Communications Loss
NTCIP_1218-1838

5.15.14 Long Communications Loss Time

<Definition> Defines the time, in minutes, from the start of a communications loss with the management station to the threshold where it is considered a long-term communications loss event. A value of 0 disables this function. A communications loss is when the RSU has not received a valid communications message from the management station. A management station may intermittently transmit a GET request for any object, such as an object in the rsuMsgRepeatStatusTable, to avoid a communication loss event. This value should be greater than the value of rsuShortCommLossTime.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.14
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-577 Configure Long-Term Communications Loss
NTCIP_1218-1839

5.15.15 System Log Name

<Definition> Contains the subdirectory (from the base directory - see rsuSysDir) and filename of the file that contains the logged events for retrieval. For example, if the value of this object is 'system.log', the queried log file would be found under the directory specified in rsuSysDir.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.15
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with ISO 26048-1 fdSyslogFilename; or change to SnmpAdminString. 
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-506 Retrieve Event Logged Data
NTCIP_1218-1840

5.15.16 System Base Directory

<Definition> Contains the base directory from which log files may be retrieved from. Note that installation files should be based on the rsuInstallPath, not rsuSysDir. If the subdirectory is relative to the root (linux 'home') directory, start with the string '/'.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.16
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with ISO 26048-1 fdSyslogPath; otherwise, change to SnmpAdminString and clarify whether trailing slashes are allowed.
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-506 Retrieve Event Logged Data
NTCIP_1218-569 Update the RSU Firmware Version
NTCIP_1218-879 Install an RSU Application
NTCIP_1218-886 Install a Configuration File
NTCIP_1218-1841

5.15.17 Long Communications Loss Reboot

<Definition> This object when set to TRUE (one) shall cause the Roadside Unit to reboot when a long-term communications loss event occurs. A value of 0 disables this function (the RSU does not reboot). A communications loss is when the RSU has not received a valid communications message from the management station. A management station may intermittently transmit a GET request for any object, such as an object in the rsuMsgRepeatStatusTable, to avoid a communication loss event.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.17
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-587 Configure Long-Term Communications Event…
NTCIP_1218-1842

5.15.18 RSU Host Network Address Parameter

<Definition> Contains the IP address for static IP network configuration of the administration ethernet port for this RSU. The value of this object is to persist even if power is lost. For an IPv4 remote destination, this address can be represented as an IPv4 quad-dotted IP address, for example, 192.33.44.235. For IPv6 remote destination, this address can be represented as zero-compressed simplified IPv6 address, for example 2031:0:130F::9C0:876A:130B. This object is read-writeable only by a user with administrator privileges.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.18
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Consider changing to InetAddressType and InetAddress

2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Should 5.15.18-5.15.22 be in a table to support configuration of multiple ports?
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-641 Configure Ethernet Ports
NTCIP_1218-1843

5.15.19 RSU Host Net Mask Parameter

<Definition> Contains the network mask for static IP network configuration of the administration ethernet port for this RSU. The value of this object is to persist even if power is lost. For an IPv4 remote destination, this address can be represented as an IPv4 quad-dotted IP address, for example, 192.33.44.235. For IPv6 remote destination, this address can be represented as zero-compressed simplified IPv6 address, for example 2031:0:130F::9C0:876A:130B. This object is read-writeable only by a user with administrator privileges.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.19
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Consider changing to InetAddressType and InetAddress
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-641 Configure Ethernet Ports
NTCIP_1218-1844

5.15.20 RSU Host Gateway Parameter

<Definition> Contains the gateway IP address for static IP network configuration of the administration ethernet port for this RSU. The value of this object is to persist even if power is lost. For an IPv4 remote destination, this address can be represented as an IPv4 quad-dotted IP address, for example, 192.33.44.235. For IPv6 remote destination, this address can be represented as zero-compressed simplified IPv6 address, for example 2031:0:130F::9C0:876A:130B. This object is read-writeable only by a user with administrator privileges.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.20

2. Consider changing to InetAddressType and InetAddress

3. Last sentence violats SNMPv3 security rules; delete
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-641 Configure Ethernet Ports
NTCIP_1218-1845

5.15.21 RSU Host Domain Name Server Parameter

<Definition> Contains the domain name server IP address of the host for configuring network IPs for this RSU. The value of this object is to persist even if power is lost. For an IPv4 remote destination, this address can be represented as an IPv4 quad-dotted IP address, for example, 192.33.44.235. For IPv6 remote destination, this address can be represented as zero-compressed simplified IPv6 address, for example 2031:0:130F::9C0:876A:130B. If the value of rsuHostDNS is 0, then DNS is disabled. This object is readwriteable only by a user with administrator privileges.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.21
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Consider changing to InetAddressType and InetAddress
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-641 Configure Ethernet Ports
NTCIP_1218-1846

5.15.22 RSU Host DHCP Enable Parameter

<Definition> The indication of whether the administration ethernet port of the RSU uses DHCP or the static IP configuration settings contained in rsuHostIpAddr, rsuHostNetMask, and rsuHostGateway. The value of this object is to persist even if power is lost.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.22
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Deprecate and replace with ipAddressTable (RFC 4293)
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-641 Configure Ethernet Ports
NTCIP_1218-1847

5.15.23 Diagnostic Signing

<Definition> When this object is set to ON (1), the RSU transmits all 'signed' WAVE messages as 'unsigned' messages. This setting overrides settings instructing the RSU to sign messages in other OIDs, for example rsuMsgRepeatOptions.secure (Bit 1) or rsuIFMOptions.secure (Bit 1). 'Unsigned' messages are transmitted with the IEEE Std 1609.2 header Ieee1609Dot2Data.unsecuredData.

If the RSU is rebooted or restarted, the rsuDiagnosticSigningDisabled will reset to a value of 0.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.23
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-1043 Support Diagnostic Mode
NTCIP_1218-1848

5.15.24 Diagnostic Signing Duration

<Definition> Defines the time, in hours, that the RSU is allowed to have diagnostic signing disabled (rsuDiagnosticSigningDisabled = 1). Upon reaching the time limit duration, the RSU shall reset the rsuDiagnosticSigningDisabled to a value of 0.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.24
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-1046 Configure Diagnostic Mode Limit
NTCIP_1218-1849

5.15.25 Consistency Check Verify Error Parameter

<Definition> This object contains a textual description of or a reference to an error that was found by a consistency check when creating a row in a dynamic table. The value of this object is only meaningful when the consistency check is not successfully completed.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.14.25
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with ISO 26048-1 fdRowStatusError

5.16 Antenna Settings

<Definition> A node containing information about antennas for the RSU.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.15
NTCIP_1218-1851

5.16.1 Maximum Antennas

<Definition> The maximum number of V2X antennas this Roadside Unit supports. This object indicates the maximum rows which appears in the rsuAntennaTable object.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.15.1
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-869 Report Maximum Number of V2X Antennas Su…
NTCIP_1218-1852

5.16.2 Antenna Table

<Definition> A table containing V2X antenna parameters. The number of rows in this table is equal to the maxRsuAntennas object.
<TableType> static
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.15.2
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-541 Store V2X Antenna Offsets
NTCIP_1218-871 Store Antenna Gain and Cable Losses
NTCIP_1218-873 Store Antenna Type
NTCIP_1218-1035 Control RF Antenna Output
NTCIP_1218-1853
<Definition> Parameters for a specific roadside unit V2X antenna.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.15.2.1
NTCIP_1218-1854
NTCIP_1218-1855

5.16.2.1 RSU Antenna Index

<Definition> Roadside unit V2X antenna Index. This value shall not exceed maxRsuAntennas.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.15.2.1.1
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-541 Store V2X Antenna Offsets
NTCIP_1218-871 Store Antenna Gain and Cable Losses
NTCIP_1218-873 Store Antenna Type
NTCIP_1218-1035 Control RF Antenna Output
NTCIP_1218-1856

5.16.2.2 RSU V2X Antenna - Latitude

<Definition> Contains the latitude location, in 10^-7 degrees, using the WGS-84 (World Geodetic System 1984), of the base of the V2X antenna. The value 900000001 represents unknown.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.15.2.1.2
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-541 Store V2X Antenna Offsets
NTCIP_1218-1857

5.16.2.3 RSU V2X Antenna - Longitude

<Definition> Contains the longitude location, in 10^-7 degrees, using the WGS-84 (World Geodetic System 1984), of the base of the V2X antenna. The value 1800000001 represents unknown.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.15.2.1.3
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-541 Store V2X Antenna Offsets
NTCIP_1218-1858

5.16.2.4 RSU V2X Antenna - Elevation

<Definition> The elevation of the base of the V2X antenna, in centimeters above the reference ellipsoid as defined by the WGS-84. The value of 1000001 represents unknown.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.15.2.1.4
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-541 Store V2X Antenna Offsets
NTCIP_1218-1859

5.16.2.5 RSU Antenna Gain

<Definition> The antenna gain for the subject antenna in hundredths of a dB. The value includes any cable losses.
<Valid Value Rule> The value of -128 represents unknown.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.15.2.1.5
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-871 Store Antenna Gain and Cable Losses
NTCIP_1218-1035 Control RF Antenna Output
NTCIP_1218-1860

5.16.2.6 RSU Antenna Directional

<Definition> The direction that the antenna is pointing (for the highest gain), in degrees from true North to the east. A value of 90 indicates the antenna is pointing east. A value of 360 indicates uniform gain in the horizontal plane. A value of 361 indicates unknown.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.15.2.1.6
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-873 Store Antenna Type
NTCIP_1218-1861

5.17 RSU System Status

<Definition> A node containing information about RSU status.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.16
NTCIP_1218-1862

5.17.1 RSU Radio Status

<Definition> Indicates which channel modes are operating. Note: Operating means the device is functioning as designed, configured, and intended.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.16.1
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-781 Report Radio Operating Modes
NTCIP_1218-1863

5.17.2 RSU Mode

<Definition> Commands the current mode of operation of the RSU and provides capability to transition the device into a new mode, e.g. from the operate mode to standby mode, etc. Standby indicates the V2X radios are not enabled and interface logging is disabled. A SET to a value of 'other' shall return a badValueError.See Section 4.3.1 for the State Machine Definition.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.16.2
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-1033 Control Mode of Operation
NTCIP_1218-1864

5.17.3 RSU Mode Status

<Definition> The current mode of operation of the RSU. Standby indicates the V2X radios are not enabled and interface logging is disabled. Fault mode indicates the RSU is not fully functional, is not transmitting messages over the V2X interface, but allows the RSU to download and install a new firmware or application version. See Section 4.3.1 for the State Machine Definition.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.16.3
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-926 Report Mode of Operations
NTCIP_1218-1147 Interface Data Logging - Operational Sta…
NTCIP_1218-1865

5.17.4 RSU Reboot

<Definition> This object when set to TRUE (one) shall cause the RSU to (a warm) reboot. This object shall automatically return to FALSE (zero) after the reboot command has been issued.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.16.4
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-1037 Reboot RSU
NTCIP_1218-1866

<Definition> Specifies the status of the current primary clock source for the RSU.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.16.6

Replace with fdClockSourceStatus
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-935 Report RSU Clock Status
NTCIP_1218-1868

5.17.7 RSU Clock Source Timeout

<Definition> Specifies the allowable period, in seconds, between valid time data from the primary time source. A value of 0 disables this function.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.16.7
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Consider fdClockSyncCycle and whether we need to submit a comment
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-937 Store Allowable RSU Clock Source Timeout
NTCIP_1218-1869

5.17.8 RSU Clock Source Queries

<Definition> Specifies the allowable number of consecutive failed attempts to request valid time data from the primary time source. A failed attempt is illustrated by no or an invalid response from the time source. A value of 0 disables this function.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.16.8
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-939 Store Allowable RSU Clock Source Queries
NTCIP_1218-1870

5.17.9 RSU Clock Deviation Tolerance

<Definition> Specifies the allowable tolerance deviation, in milliseconds, between two or more different time sources. A value of 0 disables this function.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.16.9
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Unclear what this means. I.e., what happens if there is an "unallowable" situation?
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-941 Store Allowable Time Deviation
NTCIP_1218-1871

5.17.10 RSU System Status

<Definition> The current overall status of the RSU.
Okay indicates the RSU is fully operational, with no detected service errors (See rsuServiceTable).
Warning indicates the RSU is operating, but an issue is detected which may affect its operation, e.g., wrong configuration. This status also indicates at least one RSU service has a status of warning (See rsuServiceTable).
Critical indicates an error that has a significant impact on the RSU operation, e.g., time source lost. This status also indicates at least one RSU service has a status of critical (See rsuServiceTable).
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.16.10
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Replace with fdControllerStatus and fdControllerErrorSeverity
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-994 Report RSU Current Overall Status
NTCIP_1218-1872

5.17.11 RSU PC5 Communications Status

<Definition> Specifies the status of the LTE-V2X communications. Suspended indicates when GPS time accuracy is not sufficient for reliable communications.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.16.12
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-783 Report LTE-V2X Communications Status
NTCIP_1218-1873

5.17.12 RSU Reboot Setting

<Definition> Specifies if the RSU is to use the last saved settings, or the user-configured default settings after the RSU is commanded to reboot (i.e., rsuReboot is SET to 1).

lastSaved - reverts to the last saved values of every read-write object described in NTCIP 1218, Section 5, unless explicitly stated otherwise in the object description.

userConfigured - set the RSU back to a user configured default, such as agency pre-defined settings. This requires the RSU to maintain a set of user-defined value for every object described in a MIB, including the MIB for NTCIP 1218. Note: userConfigured should disable all unused ports.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.16.13
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-1041 Configure RSU Reboot
NTCIP_1218-1874

5.18 Asynchronous Messages

<Definition> A node containing information about asynchronous messages managed by the RSU.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.17
NTCIP_1218-1875

5.18.1 Notifications
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

We need to determine if we want to keep these independent notifications and if so are they to be handled by the notification handler (see ISO 26048-1, 8.11.3). It might be better to define counter or similar objects that can be monitored by the fdCondTriggerTable and result in logs, notifications, etc. per user configuration. Consider if any of these items should be generic to all devices.
NTCIP_1218-1876

5.18.1.1 File Integrity Check Error Message

<Definition> The SNMP agent should immediately report integrity check errors on store-and-forward messages or immediate forward messages to the SNMP manager. For example, an integrity error may be detected if the message does not contain a valid UPER encoded message frame.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.17.1.1
Satisfies:

1) WAVE messages received over V2X interface,

2) WAVE messages received via SNMP to be forwarded over the V2X interface

3) both

Should this be expanded to cover ETSI messages?

5.18.3 Notification Repeat Interval

<Definition> The minimum number of seconds to wait before retransmitting a NOTIFICATION-TYPE that has not been acknowledged. A value of zero (0) indicates an immediate retransmission of the notification message.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.17.3
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with RFC 3413 snmpTargetAddrTimeout
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-631 Store Notification Repeat Intervals
NTCIP_1218-1908

5.18.4 Notification Maximum Retransmission Retries

<Definition> The maximum number of times the RSU attempts to retransmit a NOTIFICATION-TYPE that has not been acknowledged. Note: A value of one indicates that the RSU attempts a maximum of two transmissions (one retry).
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.17.4
2024-08-07: Kenneth Vaughn

Supersede with RFC 3413 snmpTargetAddrRetryCount
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-633 Store Notification Retries
NTCIP_1218-1909

5.19 RSU Applications

<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.18.1
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-555 Determine Maximum Number of Applications…
NTCIP_1218-1911

5.19.2 RSU Application Configuration Table

<Definition> A table containing application information. This table defines the parameters for the applications on this device.

<TableType> managed

<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.18.2
2024-11-13: Kenneth Vaughn

Changed to "managed" table type to conform to NTCIP 8004

2024-11-13: Kenneth Vaughn

5.19.2.5 Application Configuration Start Command Parameter

<Definition> This object when set to TRUE (one) shall cause the RSU to command the application to start at the earliest convenient time. This object shall automatically return to FALSE (zero) after the RSU has issued the start command.

NTCIP_1218-1919

5.19.2.6 Application Configuration Stop Command Parameter

<Definition> This object when set to TRUE (one) shall cause the RSU to command the application to stop at the earliest convenient time. This object shall automatically return to FALSE (zero) after the RSU has issued the stop command.

Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-1039 Control Application
NTCIP_1218-1920

5.19.2.7 Application Configuration Status

<Definition> RowStatus as defined by RFC2579 with minimum support for active(1), notInService(2), notReady(3), createAndGo(4) and destroy(6).

Prior to creating a new row, a management station should be aware of all rows already in use.

This object shall have a status of 'notReady' unless valid values exist for all objects contained in the corresponding row.

When this object has a value of 'active', an implementation shall allow modifying the values of rsuAppConfigName and this object for the corresponding row and should reject any request to modify any other object in the corresponding row.

See Requirement 3.6.9 and 3.6.10 in the PRL for performance requirements.

<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.18.2.1.7

NTCIP_1218-1927

5.20.2.2 Service Name

<Definition> This object contains the descriptive name of the service associated with this row in the RSU services table. The first 16 rows are reserved for standard services defined by this standard. All remaining rows may be used for vendor specific services. The name and assignments for the standard services are as follows:
rsuServiceID rsuServiceName Description
1 RSU system system services on the RSU
2 GNSS GNSS services
3 Time source clock sources
4 Storage file and log storage available
5 Firewall access control services
6 Network network services
7 Layers 1 and 2 radio access technology
8 Layers 3 and 4 networking services
9 Security security services
10 SCMS SCMS services
11 NTP NTP services
12-16 RESERVED reserved for future services
17-127 vendor-specific for vendor-specific services
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.19.2.1.2
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

Change to SnmpAdminString. Do we really need to keep the 127 char limit rather than the default 255?

2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

What is the distinction between application and service? There are numerous definitions for service and most that relate to an RSU would not be reflected by what is in this list and the omission of a better definition prevents any real interoperability

5.20.2.3 Service Status

<Definition> The current status of the service for that row on the RSU.
Okay indicates the service is fully operational with no errors.
Warning indicates the service is operating, but an error is detected which may affect its operation, e.g., wrong configuration.
Critical indicates an error is detected that has a significant impact on the RSU operation.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.19.2.1.3
Satisfies:

NTCIP_1218-1008 Report Network Service Status
NTCIP_1218-1010 Report Radio Access Service Status
NTCIP_1218-1012 Report V2X Radio Networking Services Sta…
NTCIP_1218-1014 Report IEEE 1609.2 Status
NTCIP_1218-1016 Report SCMS Service Status
NTCIP_1218-1018 Report Vendor Specific Services Status
NTCIP_1218-1024 Report NTP Server Service Status
NTCIP_1218-1929

5.20.2.4 Service Status Description

<Definition> Provides detailed information for the current status of the service for that row on the RSU, e.g., the cause for a Warning status or Critical status value. The value Okay indicates the service is fully operational with no errors.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.19.2.1.4

NTCIP_1218-1931

5.20.2.6 Service Row Status

<Definition> RowStatus as defined by RFC2579 with minimum support for active(1), notInService(2), notReady(3), createAndGo(4) and destroy(6)

Prior to creating a new row, a management station should be aware of all rows already in use.

This object shall have a status of 'notReady' unless valid values exist for all objects contained in the corresponding row.

When this object has a value of 'active', an implementation shall allow modifying the values of this object for the corresponding row and should reject any request to modify any other object in the corresponding row.

See Requirement 3.6.9 and 3.6.10 in the PRL for performance requirements.

<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.19.2.1.6
2024-10-16: Kenneth Vaughn

rows are populated with system services and applications. Their entries only permit users to modify, but never “create or destroy”. A manager cannot “add an application” to the RSU simply by adding a row to the rsuAppConfigTable. So, our implementation won’t provide this RowStatus and don’t think this is necessary as in other dynamic tables. (NTCIPv01.44b-14)

2024-11-13: Kenneth Vaughn

Revised text to conform to RFC 2579 recommendations.

2024-11-13: Kenneth Vaughn

Is there any situation where we do not want to allow disabling (e.g., when in use)?

NTCIP_1218-1018 Report Vendor Specific Services Status
NTCIP_1218-1932

<Definition> Indicates the enabled state of the NTP service. A value of 1 indicates that the NTP Service is enabled; a value of 0 indicates that the NTP Service is disabled.

5.21.2.2 Transmitted Messages for Forwarding PSID

<Definition> The Provider Service Identifier (PSID) of a Message Transmitted by the RSU over the V2X Interface to be forwarded. The current PSID assignments can be found at https://standards.ieee.org/products-services/regauth/psid/public/. A value of 0x00 indicates that all messages transmitted by the RSU over the V2X Interface is to be forwarded.

5.21.2.3 Transmitted Messages for Forwarding Destination Address

<Definition> Destination Server IP address to forward the message transmitted by the RSU over the V2X Interface. For an IPv4 remote destination, this address can be represented as an IPv4 quad-dotted IP address, for example, 192.33.44.235. For IPv6 remote destination, this address can be represented as zero-compressed simplified IPv6 address, for example 2031:0:130F::9C0:876A:130B.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.20.2.1.3

5.21.2.8 Received Message Forward Secure Option

<Definition> A value of 0 indicates the RSU is to forward only the unsigned SPDU (the WSM message payload without security headers).

A value of 1 indicates the RSU is to forward the signed SPDU, which includes all the signatures and trailers. The SPDU is defined in IEEE 1609.2.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.20.2.1.8

NTCIP_1218-1946

5.21.2.9 Transmitted Messages for Forwarding Status

<Definition> RowStatus as defined by RFC2579 with minimum support for active(1), notInService(2), notReady(3), createAndGo(4) and destroy(6).

Prior to creating a new row, a management station should be aware of all rows already in use.

This object shall have a status of 'notReady' unless valid values exist for all objects contained in the corresponding row.

When this object has a value of 'active', an implementation shall allow modifying the values of rsuXmitMsgFwdingDeliveryStart, rsuXmitMsgFwdingDeliveryStop, and this object for the corresponding row and should reject any request to modify any other object in the corresponding row.

See Requirement 3.6.9 and 3.6.10 in the PRL for performance requirements.

<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.20.2.1.9

NTCIP_1218-1947

5.22 Data Exchanges with Actuated Signal Controllers

<Definition> A node containing information about exchanging data with actuated signal controllers.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21
NTCIP_1218-1948

5.22.1 ASC Current Tick Counter

<Definition> This object is a counter of the number of elapsed ASC traffic processing ticks. The value is incremented by 1 (decisecond) every time the ASC completes its tenth of a second processing and commits a new set of IO signal states.

The object is represented as a rolling counter with a zero representing the top of the hour. If the counter were to be incremented beyond 35999, unless a leap seconds occur, the value shall roll over back to 0. The values 36000..36009 are used when a leap second occurs. The values 36010..36110 are reserved for future use. 36111 is to be used when the value is undefined or unknown.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.1
2024-08-09: Kenneth Vaughn

The tick syntax is used frequently enough that a TC would be useful, it would also allow a DISPLY-HINT to be provided
NTCIP_1218-1949

5.22.2 Maximum Number of Signal Groups

<Definition> This object indicates the maximum number of signal groups that RSU may receive data from an ASC for.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.2
NTCIP_1218-1950

5.22.3 Maximum Number of Movement Events

<Definition> This object indicates the maximum number of movement events for a signal group that RSU may receive data from an ASC for.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.3
NTCIP_1218-1951

5.22.4 RSU Signal Status Table

<Definition> A table containing the signal phase and timing data for the current and upcoming movements for each signal group.
<TableType> static
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4
2024-10-16: Kenneth Vaughn

while clearly a step forward to describe the objects needed to facilitate exchange of intersection state information between TSC and RSU in this amendment, use of SNMP may hamper the timeliness of SPaT messages as compared to the traditional (and unsecure) TSCBM via UDP.  It may be a negligible overall delta, but unpacking the PDU, as received through an SNMP agent, and then doing whatever vendor specific magic is required for transmitting the SPaT message seems to be a little more processing intensive. (NTCIPv01.44b-17)
NTCIP_1218-1952
<Definition> Parameters for a specific signal group.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4.1
NTCIP_1218-1953
NTCIP_1218-1954

5.22.4.1 ASC SPaT Signal Group Entry Number

<Definition> The number for objects in this row. This value shall not exceed the maxRsuSignalGroups object value.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4.1.1
NTCIP_1218-1955

5.22.4.2 ASC SPaT Movement Event Number

<Definition> The movement index for objects in this row. This value shall not exceed the maxRsuMovementEvents object value. Index value 1 contains the value for the current interval and Index value 2 contains the value for the next interval.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4.1.2
NTCIP_1218-1956

5.22.4.3 ASC SPaT Intersection Identifier

<Definition> The number is used to uniquely define an intersection within the region. A value of 0 indicates that the row is disabled and all other values in the row are not valid.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4.1.3
NTCIP_1218-1957

5.22.4.4 ASC SPaT Signal Group Identifier

<Definition> The number used to map between a movement phase state (and its timings) in the CU and movements defined in a MAP message for the intersection. A value of 255 is reserved to indicate a permanent green movement state.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4.1.4
NTCIP_1218-1958

5.22.4.5 ASC SPaT Event State

<Definition> This object value defines the movement phase state for a signal group. rsuMovementIndex.1 indicates the current movement phase state, and rsuMovementIndex.2 indicates the next movement phase state. If the movement phase state is unknown, a value of 2 is used.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4.1.5
NTCIP_1218-1959

5.22.4.6 ASC SPaT Signal State Minimum End Time

<Definition> The tick count from the ASC representing the earliest future time point when the rsuSignalState is expected to change, excluding unexpected events such as a preempt request. This object is used with the rsuAscCurrentTick object. The value of this object will remain constant if the predicted future time point of the event does not change. Values from 0 to 35999 cover one hour. Values from 36000 to 36009 are used when a leap second occurs. Values from 36010 to 36110 are reserved to future use. A value of 36111 indicates the time point of the event is undefined or unknown.

If rsuSignalStateMinEndTick is greater than rsuAscCurrentTick then the end time is in the current hour. If rsuSignalStateMinEndTick is less than rsuCurrentTick then the time is in the next hour.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4.1.6
NTCIP_1218-1960

5.22.4.7 ASC SPaT Signal State Maximum End Time

<Definition> The tick count from the ASC representing the latest future time point when the rsuSignalState is expected to change, excluding unexpected events such as a preempt request. This object is used with the rsuAscCurrentTick object. The value of this object will remain constant if the predicted future time point of the event does not change. Values from 0 to 35999 cover one hour. Values from 36000 to 36009 are used when a leap second occurs. Values from 36010 to 36110 are reserved to future use. A value of 36111 indicates the time point of the event is undefined or unknown.

If rsuSignalStateMaxEndTick is greater than rsuAscCurrentTick then the end time is in the current hour. If rsuSignalStateMaxEndTick is less than rsuAscCurrentTick then the time is in the next hour.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4.1.7
NTCIP_1218-1961

5.22.4.8 ASC SPaT Signal State Likely Time

<Definition> The tick count from the ASC representing the most likely future time point when the rsuSignalState is expected to change, excluding unexpected events such as a preempt request. This object is used with the rsuAscCurrentTick object. The value of this object will remain constant if the predicted future time point of the event does not change. Values from 0 to 35999 cover one hour. Values from 36000 to 36009 are used when a leap second occurs. Values from 36010 to 36110 are reserved to future use. A value of 36111 indicates the time point of the event is undefined or unknown.

If rsuSignalStateLikelyEndTick is greater than rsuAscCurrentTick then the end time is in the current hour. If rsuSignalStateLikelyEndTick is less than rsuAscCurrentTick then the time is in the next hour.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4.1.6
NTCIP_1218-1962

5.22.4.9 ASC SPaT Signal State Time Confidence

<Definition> The statistical confidence in the predicted value of the rsuSignalStateLikelyEndTick.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4.1.9
NTCIP_1218-1963

5.22.4.10 ASC SPaT Signal Next Tick

<Definition> The tick count from the ASC representing the most likely future time point when the movement is expected to be allowed to move again (e.g., green), excluding unexpected events such as a preempt request. This object is used with the rsuAscCurrentTick object. The value of this object will remain constant if the predicted future time point of the event does not change. Values from 0 to 35999 cover one hour. Values from 36000 to 36009 are used when a leap second occurs. Values from 36010 to 36110 are reserved to future use. A value of 36111 indicates the time point of the event is undefined or unknown.

If rsuSignalStateNextTick is greater than rsuAscCurrentTick then the next time is in the current hour. If rsuSignalStateNextTick is less than rsuAscCurrentTick then the time is in the next hour.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4.1.10
NTCIP_1218-1964

5.22.4.11 ASC SPaT Signal Start Tick

<Definition> The tick count from the ASC representing the start time of the next (future) movement state to follow the current movement state for a signal group. This object is used with the rsuAscCurrentTick object. The value of this object will remain constant if the predicted future time point of the event does not change. Values from 0 to 35999 cover one hour. Values from 36000 to 36009 are used when a leap second occurs. Values from 36010 to 36110 are reserved to future use. A value of 36111 indicates the time point of the event is undefined or unknown.

If rsuSignalStateStartTick is greater than rsuAscCurrentTick then the start time of the next movement state is in the current hour. If rsuSignalStateStartTick is less than rsuAscCurrentTick then the time is in the next hour.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.4.1.11
NTCIP_1218-1965

5.22.5 Maximum SPaT Movement Maneuvers

<Definition> This object indicates the maximum number of rows which shall appear in the rsuMovementManeuverTable object.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.5

<Definition> This object provides an estimated distance in meters from the stop bar to the back edge of the last vehicle in the queue for this movement, along the lane centerline.

NTCIP_1218-1973

5.22.6.5 ASC SPaT Movement Assist Status

<Definition> This object SET by the ASC indicating options for traveler connections through an intersection.
Bit 7: Reserved
Bit 6: Reserved
Bit 5: Reserved
Bit 4: Reserved
Bit 3: Reserved
Bit 2: Reserved
Bit 1: Status bit set to TRUE (1) if ANY pedestrians or bicyclists are detected in a conflicting movement. Set to FALSE (0) if there is a high certainty no pedestrians or bicyclists are present.
Bit 0: Reserved
A SET of a 'reserved' bit to a value other than zero (0) shall return a badValue(3) error.
See Section 2.5 of RFC 3416 for encoding.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.6.1.5
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-892 Receive Movement Maneuver Assist – NTCIP…

<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.2.18.21.8.1.7
Satisfies:
NTCIP_1218-894 Receive Advisory Speed – NTCIP 1202 v03B
NTCIP_1218-1985

5.22.9 ASC Intersection Status

<Definition> If a bit is enabled or active, the associated bit shall be set to (1). The definition of the term 'recent' is defined by the system in use. Bit 0 is equal to Bit 0 of the BIT STRING of DE_IntersectionStatusObject, Bit 1 is equal to Bit 1, etc.
Bit 0: Enabled when unitControlStatus is remoteManualControl (9) or localManualControl (10)
Bit 1: Enabled when Bit 4: Stop Time in unitAlarmStatus2 is TRUE
Bit 2: Enabled when unitFlashStatus is localManual (4), faultMonitor (5), or mmu (6). This bit may also be enabled if the preemptState is other(1) and indeterminate.
Bit 3: Enabled when the preemptState for any preempt is any value other than notActive (2) or notActiveWithCall (3). This bit may also be enabled if the preemptState is other(1) and determinate.
Bit 4: Enabled when the priorityStrategyRequestStatusInCO for any priority request is a value of requestQueued (2), or activeProcessing (4).
Bit 5: Enabled if the CU is operating in fixedTime mode. This bit and bit 6 cannot both be simultaneously active (1).
Bit 6: Enabled if the CU is operating in an actuated mode. This bit and bit 5 cannot both be simultaneously active (1).
Bit 7: Enabled if the unitFlashStatus is automatic (3), startup (7), or preempt (8).
Bit 8: Controller failure or failure in operation.
Bit 9: Reserved. SET to 0.
Bit 10: Reserved. SET to 1.
Bit 11: Reserved. SET to 1.
Bit 12: Enabled if the MAP message is invalid.
Bit 13: Enabled if the SPaT message is invalid.
Bits 14-15: Reserved

The default bit value for Bits 10 and 11 is enabled (1). The default bit value for all other Bits is disabled (0).
See Section 2.5 of RFC 3416 for encoding.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.18.21.9
NTCIP_1218-1986

5.22.10 Road Authority Identifier

<Definition> This object is the unique identifier of the agency for the SPaT and MAP message. This object shall be either a valid OBJECT IDENTIFIER or a null string.
<Object Identifier> 1.3.6.1.4.1.1206.4.18.21.10
